<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Introductory Note</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">This
Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30,
2005 (the &#147;Form&nbsp;10-K&#148;) contains &#147;forward-looking statements,&#148; as defined
in Section&nbsp;27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#147;Securities
Act&#148;), and Section&nbsp;21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended
(the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;).&#160; Forward-looking
statements are statements other than historical information or statements of
current condition and relate to future events or the future financial
performance of the Company.&#160; Some
forward-looking statements may be identified by use of such terms as &#147;believes,&#148;
&#147;anticipates,&#148; &#147;intends&#148; or &#147;expects.&#148;&#160;
Such forward-looking statements involve known and unknown risks,
uncertainties and other factors that may cause the actual results, performance
or achievements of the Company to be materially different from any future
results, performance or achievements expressed or implied by such
forward-looking statements.&#160; Such risks,
uncertainties, and other factors that may cause such a difference include,
without limitation, those noted under &#147;Risks That May&nbsp;Affect Future
Results&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;10.&#160; The Company undertakes no obligation to
update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new
information, future events or otherwise.</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;I</font></b></h1>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 1.&#160; Business</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General Overview</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cruzan
International,&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) is a producer and supplier of rum,
brandy, wine and spirits to other beverage alcohol manufacturers; produces,
imports and markets premium branded spirits; bottles beverage alcohol and other
beverages on a contract basis and under private labels; and produces vinegar
and cooking wine.&#160; The Company operates
four production facilities in the United States and one in St. Croix, United
States Virgin Islands, and purchases certain products for resale.&#160; The Company is a Delaware corporation
organized in 1970 as a successor to a business founded in the Bahamas in 1964.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Market
share and industry data and rankings disclosed in this report have been
obtained from industry and government publications, as indicated; the Company
has not independently verified this information, although management believes
such data and rankings to be reasonably accurate.&#160; All references in this report to &#147;Fiscal 2005,&#148;
&#147;Fiscal 2004&#148; and &#147;Fiscal 2003&#148; refer to the Company&#146;s fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30
of such year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dominant Supplier
of Bulk Alcohol Products</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management
believes that the Company is the largest supplier of bulk rum in the United
States based on reports of U.S. Imports for Consumption prepared by the
Department of Census and that the Company&#146;s market share of bulk rum products
in the United States is more than 90%.&#160;
Management believes that the Company is the largest supplier of
fortified citrus wine in the United States and is only aware of one other
domestic supplier of fortified citrus wine.&#160;
Management is aware of only one other United States manufacturer of
citrus brandy and citrus spirits and believes that the Company&#146;s market share
for these products is approximately 80% and 60%, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2005 Developments</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Name Change</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;2,
2005, the Company announced that it had changed its name from Todhunter
International,&nbsp;Inc. to Cruzan International,&nbsp;Inc.&#160; The new name, approved by the Company&#146;s shareholders
on March&nbsp;15, 2005, reflects the Company&#146;s evolving strategic focus on its
Cruzan Rum brand, which has continued to experience tremendous growth since its
repositioning in the marketplace in the late 1990s.&#160; In conjunction with its new corporate
identity, on May&nbsp;3, 2005, the Company&#146;s common stock began trading on the
American Stock Exchange under its new symbol, &#147;RUM.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Change of Control and Merger Agreement</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On June&nbsp;3,
2005, the Company announced that Angostura, Ltd. (&#147;Angostura&#148;), the Company&#146;s
then controlling stockholder, had entered into a Stock Purchase Agreement with
V&amp;S Vin&nbsp;&amp; Sprit AB, a Swedish-based</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='1',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">international wine and spirits company (&#147;V&amp;S&#148;), pursuant to which
V&amp;S agreed to purchase Angostura&#146;s controlling interest in the
Company.&#160; Upon the terms and subject to
the conditions set forth in the Stock Purchase Agreement, V&amp;S agreed to
purchase all 4,294,583 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock beneficially owned
by Angostura, representing approximately 63.6% of the Company&#146;s outstanding
common stock, for an aggregate consideration of $121,837,320, or $28.37 per
share.&#160; V&amp;S subsequently assigned its
rights in the Stock Purchase Agreement to The Absolut Spirits Company,&nbsp;Inc.,
a Delaware corporation (&#147;ASCI&#148;), its wholly-owned subsidiary.&#160; The purchase and sale closed on September&nbsp;26,
2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;8,
2005, the Company announced that ASCI had submitted a proposed Agreement and
Plan of Merger pursuant to which a wholly-owned subsidiary of ASCI would merge
with and into the Company, and each issued share of Company common stock not
then owned by Angostura would be converted into the right to receive $28.37 in
cash (the &#147;ASCI Proposal&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;30,
2005, the Company, ASCI, and Cruzan Acquisition,&nbsp;Inc., a Delaware
corporation and a direct, wholly-owned subsidiary of ASCI (&#147;Sub&#148;), entered into
an Agreement and Plan of Merger (the &#147;Merger Agreement&#148;).&#160; The Merger Agreement provides that, upon the
terms and subject to the conditions set forth in the Merger Agreement, Sub will
merge with and into the Company (the &#147;Merger&#148;), with the Company continuing as
the surviving corporation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;1,
2005, the Company filed a preliminary proxy statement and other relevant
documents concerning the ASCI Proposal with the Securities and Exchange
Commission (the &#147;Commission&#148;) and intends to call a Special Meeting of its
stockholders to vote on the Merger.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other Developments</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
Fiscal 2005, the Company continued its strategy of growing its premium branded
spirits segment and capitalizing on its position in the flavored rum category
by expanding its sales force and increasing its marketing budget, partly in
response to increased competition from the Company&#146;s major rum spirits
competitors, primarily Bacardi, Diageo, Remy Cointreau and Pernod Ricard.&#160; Fiscal 2005 was the second year that the
Company sponsored celebrity entertainer Kenny Chesney to increase the brand
awareness of Cruzan Rum.&#160; Kenny Chesney
was the Country Music Awards and American Music Awards &#147;Entertainer of the Year&#148;
and Academy of Country Music top male vocalist of the year in 2004.&#160; The Company has a sponsorship contract with
Kenny Chesney for an additional two years.&#160;
Management believes that the Company&#146;s brand promotion strategies have
been effective in increasing the sales growth of the Cruzan Rum brand by 21%
during Fiscal 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In June&nbsp;2005,
the Company received $5.5 million, net of expenses, from a fully subscribed
rights offering and as a result issued 408,787 shares of common stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
order to reduce losses in the Company&#146;s bottling operations, in December&nbsp;2004,
management decided to discontinue production of all products in the Lake Alfred
bottling plant with the exception of one bottling line that bottles vinegar,
cooking wine and juices.&#160; In January&nbsp;2005,
the operation of this bottling line was reduced to one shift.&#160; At the present time, the Company has not
taken an impairment charge relating to its bottling operations as the carrying
value of its bottling assets is less than fair value.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December&nbsp;14,
2005, the Company entered into a loan arrangement with V&amp;S consisting of a
$30 million term promissory note and a $10 million revolving promissory note,
both of which are unsecured, bear interest at the applicable LIBOR rate plus 90
basis points and mature on December&nbsp;15, 2006.&#160; The notes are non-amortizing and have no
financial covenant requirements.&#160; On December&nbsp;16,
2005, the Company used the proceeds of these notes to refinance its existing
credit agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
Fiscal 2005, the Company had a loss before income tax benefit of $14.5 million
compared to a loss before income tax benefit of $4.6 million in Fiscal
2004.&#160; After income taxes, the Company&#146;s
net loss was $10.7 million in Fiscal 2005 compared to a net loss of $0.9
million in Fiscal 2004.&#160; This loss was
primarily due to (1)&nbsp;the increased marketing expenditures in our premium
branded spirits segment, (2)&nbsp;continuing losses in the Company&#146;s bottling
operations and (3)&nbsp;the recording, as an expense, of the obligation of Angostura,
the former majority owner of the Company, to make a payment of $9,000,000 to
certain members of management of the Company.&#160;
Pursuant to a letter agreement entered into between Angostura and
certain of the Company&#146;s management on June&nbsp;2, 2005, Angostura agreed to
pay to certain of the Company&#146;s management an aggregate amount of $9 million if
the sale of</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Angostura&#146;s controlling interest in the Company to ASCI were
completed.&#160; Although this sale was
completed on September&nbsp;26, 2005, as of December&nbsp;16, 2005, this
payment has not been made.&#160; This payment
is not the obligation of the Company and was negotiated between certain members
of management and the former majority owner without the participation of or
ratification by the Company&#146;s board of directors or any committee thereof and
does not affect the Company&#146;s balance sheet or cash flow statement.&#160; However, under Staff Accounting Bulletin 107
issued by the Commission relating to accounting for expenses or liabilities
paid by principal stockholder(s), this expected payment by Angostura was
treated as an expense of the Company in the statement of operations, and as a
contribution to additional paid-in capital on the balance sheet.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Business Segments</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company operates primarily in the beverage alcohol industry in the United
States.&#160; The Company reports its results
in four operating segments:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">Bulk Alcohol Products (rum, citrus
brandy, citrus spirits, cane spirits, fortified citrus wine, purchased distilled
products and byproducts)</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">Premium Branded Spirits (primarily
Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums)</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">Bottling Operations (contract
bottling services and private label products)</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">Vinegar and Cooking Wine (bulk
vinegar, bulk cooking wine, vinegar stock and private label case goods)</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Information
regarding the net sales, operating income (loss) and total assets of each of
the Company&#146;s business segments and information regarding geographic areas is
set forth in Note 13 to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Bulk
Alcohol Products.</font></i>&#160; The
Company produces and sells rum, citrus brandy, citrus spirits, cane spirits and
fortified citrus wine in the United States and internationally.&#160; The Company also purchases distilled products
for resale, including grain alcohol, which is denatured and packaged and sold
as industrial alcohol to hospitals, universities, fragrance producers and other
manufacturers.&#160; The Company is the
largest supplier of bulk rum in the United States, and it also supplies citrus
brandy and fortified citrus wine.&#160; The
Company sells its bulk alcohol products to over 40 producers of beverage
alcohol in the United States and exports bulk alcohol products to approximately
20 foreign countries. The Company&#146;s distilling operations produce a byproduct,
which is sold as animal feed.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Citrus
brandy and spirits are distilled from citrus juice byproducts purchased from
manufacturers of citrus juice concentrate. The Company&#146;s citrus brandy is used
primarily as an ingredient in flavored brandies. Citrus spirits are used
primarily as a fortifying ingredient to increase the alcohol content of the
Company&#146;s citrus wine and the wine of other manufacturers. The Company&#146;s citrus
wine is fermented from citrus juice and fortified with citrus spirits to
increase its alcohol content to approximately 20% by volume. Known as fortified
citrus wine, this product is used primarily as an ingredient in cordials,
whiskies and other beverage alcohol. Rum and cane spirits are distilled from
sugar cane molasses and are sold to other bottlers of rum, producers of
beverage alcohol, food companies and flavor manufacturers.&#160; Rum is also used in the Company&#146;s premium
branded spirits and bottling operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management
believes that the Company&#146;s proximity to raw materials and its use of citrus
byproducts in the production of bulk alcohol provide it with cost advantages
over competitors&#146; products. Because end products are taxed on a blended rate
based upon the ingredients used rather than on the resulting alcohol content of
the end product, beverage alcohol producers can lower excise taxes on their
products by substituting fortified citrus wine for distilled spirits
alternatives. This cost savings arises because fortified citrus wine is
currently subject to federal excise taxes of $1.57 per gallon, whereas
distilled spirits are taxed at $13.50 per proof gallon (one proof gallon is
approximately equivalent in alcohol content to two and one-half gallons of
fortified citrus wine). The ability of beverage alcohol producers to substitute
fortified citrus wine for distilled spirits varies by end product in accordance
with government regulations. For example, fortified citrus wine may contribute
up to 49% of the alcohol content of cordials and liqueurs, and up to approximately
10% of the alcohol content of Canadian whiskey. In addition, small quantities
of fortified citrus wine may be used in blended whiskey, rum, brandy and other
types of beverage alcohol.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Florida citrus harvest generally occurs during the months from November&nbsp;through
June.&#160; The majority of the Florida citrus
harvest is processed as fresh fruit juice or juice concentrate.&#160; A byproduct of citrus juice production is
citrus molasses, which the Company uses as a raw material in its distilling
operations to produce citrus brandy and spirits.&#160; Due to the seasonal availability and short &#147;shelf-life&#148;
of the citrus molasses raw material, the Company produces its estimated annual
customer requirements during a seven-month period, and therefore carries a
higher than normal level of inventory in relation to sales during this
seven-month period.&#160; Generally, the
Company&#146;s inventory levels increase during this seven-month period, and when
the citrus harvest ends the Company supplies its customers with citrus brandy
and spirits from inventory from July&nbsp;through October.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Premium
Branded Spirits.</font></i>&#160; The
Company manufactures, imports, exports, and markets a variety of premium
branded spirits.&#160; The Company&#146;s premium
branded spirits include Cruzan Estate Rums, Cruzan Flavored Rums, Hine Cognac,
Conch Republic Rum, Ron Carlos Rum and Antioqueno Aguardiente. The Company&#146;s
primary spirits brand is Cruzan Rum, which is the fourth-largest premium rum
brand in the United States according to statistics published by Impact Databank
and Adams Liquor Handbook, two leading spirits industry publications.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s strategy is to market high quality products that satisfy the
preferences of consumers of legal drinking age and to support those products
with international, national, and regional marketing programs.&#160; These programs are intended to extend
consumer brand recognition and brand loyalty.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the
United States, the Company sells branded spirits either through wholesale
distributors or directly to state governments in those states that control
alcohol sales.&#160; Typically, the Company
does not have contracts with its distributors although some states have
statutes that limit the Company&#146;s ability to terminate distributor
relationships.&#160; Outside the United
States, the Company typically distributes its products by selecting the best
local distributor for its brands in each specific market. The Company&#146;s
principal export markets for Cruzan Rum are Canada, Central America, the
Caribbean, Scandinavia, the Baltic States, Italy, France, the Philippines,
Israel, New Zealand and the Global Duty Free Markets (40 countries).&#160; The Company has a distribution agreement with
V&amp;S that provides for joint marketing and for the distribution by V&amp;S
of Cruzan products in the international spirits market where the Company has
not already established a distributor relationship.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
principal raw materials used in manufacturing and packaging Cruzan Rum are cane
molasses, glass bottles, cartons, and oak barrels, which are used for storage
and aging. Currently, none of these raw materials is in short supply, and there
are adequate sources from which they may be obtained.&#160; See discussion under &#147;Raw Materials&#148; for
additional disclosures related to sourcing cane molasses and glass bottles.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
alcohol industry is highly competitive and there are many brands sold in the
consumer market. Trade information indicates that the Company is one of the
smaller branded spirit suppliers in the United States in terms of revenues, although
Cruzan Rum has been recognized as one of the fastest growing brands in the
United States by Impact Databank and Adams Liquor Handbook, two leading
industry publications.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau of the United States Treasury Department
regulates the wine and spirits industry with respect to production, blending,
bottling, sales, advertising and transportation of alcohol products.&#160; Also, each state regulates advertising,
promotion, transportation, sale, and distribution of such products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There
are no federal regulations that require minimum aging to be designated rum.
However, due to the Company&#146;s high quality standards, the Company ages its
Cruzan Estate Rums for two to five years and certain of the Company&#146;s super
premium rums are aged up to 12 years. Due to the Company&#146;s own aging
requirements, production of Cruzan Estate Rums is scheduled to meet demand two
to three years in the future.&#160;
Accordingly, inventories are larger in relation to sales and total
assets than for other branded spirits suppliers that do not age their
products.&#160; Management expects to continue
to increase the Company&#146;s inventory of barrel aged rums to meet increased sales
in the future.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Bottling
Operations.</font></i>&#160; The
Company&#146;s bottling operations include contract bottling services and the
production, bottling and marketing of distilled spirits under its own private
labels and under the private labels of retailers.&#160; The Company&#146;s primary bottling operations are
located in Florida and primarily serve customers in the Southeastern United
States.&#160; The Company also produces and
sells proprietary label products in the United States Virgin Islands.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Contract
bottling products include distilled spirits, coolers, prepared cocktails and
fruit juices.&#160; The Company had two large
contract bottling customers which accounted for 76% of the bottling operations
case volume and 38% of bottling operations net sales for the year ended September&nbsp;30,
2005.&#160; One of these contracts is for two
years, expiring December&nbsp;2007, and the other contract was on a
year-to-year basis and has expired.&#160;
Also, in July&nbsp;2005, the Company entered into a bottling contract
with a new contract bottling customer.&#160;
The contract is for five years, expiring July&nbsp;2010, but can be
terminated within 180 days during the first year and within 90 days during each
year thereafter.&#160; The Company expects to
produce approximately 750,000 cases per year under this contract.&#160; Each of the Company&#146;s existing contracts
provides for advance notification of quarterly production requirements,
although there are no minimum volume requirements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Private
label products include rum, gin, vodka, tequila, cordials and various
whiskies.&#160; The Company&#146;s private label
products are marketed in the popular-price category of the distilled spirits
market.&#160; The Company has one large
private label customer which accounted for approximately 6% of bottling
operations case volume and 17% of bottling operations net sales for the year
ended September&nbsp;30, 2005.&#160; Net sales
from this customer are based on short-term arrangements that may terminate at
any time. Although the Company does not have long-term contracts with its
private label customers, management believes that its relations with its
customers are good.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company sells its private label products to distributors located primarily in
the Southeastern United States.&#160; The
Company does not have contracts with distributors for its private label
products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Vinegar
and Cooking Wine.</font></i>&#160; To
complement its distilling, winery and bottling operations, the Company produces
vinegar, vinegar stock, and cooking wine.&#160;
The Company sells vinegar and cooking wine to over 700 condiment
manufacturers, food service distributors and major retailers in the United
States and Canada. The Company&#146;s sales to retailers are made under the Company&#146;s
private labels and retailers&#146; private labels.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company has three large vinegar and cooking wine customers which accounted for
23% of the net sales of vinegar and cooking wine for the year ended September&nbsp;30,
2005.&#160;&#160; Although the Company does not
have long-term supply contracts with its vinegar and cooking wine customers,
management believes that its relations with its customers are good and that the
Company&#146;s products are competitively priced.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Corporate
Operations.</font></i>&#160; The
Company&#146;s executive offices are located in West Palm Beach, Florida and certain
of the expenses of the Company&#146;s executive offices are not allocated to the
operating segments described above.&#160;
These expenses include salaries and related expenses, legal and
professional fees, rent for office space, utilities and insurance.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Dependence on
Major Customers</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No
single customer was responsible for more than 10% of the Company&#146;s consolidated
net sales during Fiscal 2005.&#160; The
Company has five major customers in its bulk alcohol products segment, three
major customers in its bottling operations segment, and three major customers
in its vinegar and cooking wine segment; the loss of one or more of these major
customers in any of these segments could have a material adverse effect on that
segment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Production</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s principal domestic production facilities are located in Lake Alfred
and Auburndale, Florida, both near Orlando and central to Florida&#146;s citrus
growing region. The two plants have similar distilling, bottling and winery
operations, allowing the Company to shift production from one plant to the
other. The Lake Alfred plant also has a vinegar production facility. Both
plants are near major highways and are serviced by a railroad, providing good
transportation access. The Company has a cold storage, warehousing and plastic
bottle manufacturing facility in Winter Haven, Florida. The Company also
operates a winery and vinegar production facility in Louisville, Kentucky. The
Company&#146;s rum production facilities are located in St.&nbsp;Croix, United
States Virgin Islands.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Distilling.</font></i>&#160; The Company begins its distilling process
with citrus or cane molasses, which is fermented for approximately two to four
days. Once fermented, the product has an average alcohol content of 9% by
volume, which is increased to approximately 95% through distillation. The
alcohol is further purified through rectifying columns which remove impurities.
The finished product is stored in stainless steel tanks, except for rum, which
is</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">generally stored in wooden barrels for aging purposes. The Lake Alfred,
Auburndale and Virgin Islands facilities can produce, on a combined basis, up
to 23 million proof gallons of distilled products per year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Winery.</font></i>&#160; Wine is produced by the fermentation of
citrus or grape juice. After fermentation, the wine is fortified by the
addition of distilled citrus spirits to raise its alcohol content to
approximately 20% by volume. Fortified citrus wine is sold to producers of
beverage alcohol. The wineries are physically segregated from the distilling
operations and have their own sets of fermenting and storage tanks. The Lake
Alfred, Auburndale and Louisville facilities can produce, on a combined basis,
up to 30&nbsp;million gallons of wine per year.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Bottling.</font></i>&#160; The Lake Alfred plant has one line that is
used primarily to bottle vinegar, cooking wine and juices.&#160; The Auburndale plant has two lines that are
dedicated to bottling coolers and prepared cocktails and three lines that
bottle private label products and premium branded spirits. The Company&#146;s
warehouse storage areas can accommodate up to 1,000,000 cases. The Company&#146;s
plant in the Virgin Islands has one line capable of bottling up to 250,000
cases per year.&#160; The Company distills and
ages its own rum, but generally produces its other private label products from
alcohol purchased from third parties. Depending on the particular formula for a
product, the Company adds flavoring and/or sugar, reduces the product&#146;s proof
and then filters and bottles the finished product.&#160; The Company&#146;s bottling capacity is
approximately 6 million cases per year.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Vinegar
and Cooking Wine.</font></i>&#160;
Vinegar is produced by converting alcohol into acetic acid. Several
varieties of vinegar, including white distilled, red wine, white wine, corn,
rice wine, malt, balsamic and apple cider, are produced at the Lake Alfred and
Louisville facilities, which have a combined capacity of 10&nbsp;million grain
gallons per year. Cooking wine is produced by the controlled fermentation of
red or white grape juice into wine and is then denatured with salt or other
ingredients.&#160; Because of this denaturing
process, these products are not subject to federal excise taxes.&#160; Several varieties of cooking wine, including
red, white, sherry, golden, marsala and chablis, are produced at the Lake
Alfred, Auburndale and Louisville facilities.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Quality
Control.</font></i>&#160; Each of the
Company&#146;s facilities is equipped with a quality control laboratory. The Company
employs several chemists who continually test to ensure the quality of raw
materials and end products.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Raw
Materials.</font></i>&#160; The cost of
raw materials fluctuates depending upon a number of factors, including crop
conditions, weather, governmental programs and purchases by foreign
governments.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
principal raw materials used in the Company&#146;s distilling operations are citrus
molasses, a byproduct of citrus juice production, and cane molasses, a
byproduct of sugar production. Citrus molasses, which is used in the production
of citrus brandy and citrus spirits, accounted for approximately 55% of the raw
materials used in the Company&#146;s distilling operations in Fiscal 2005. Cane
molasses, which is used in the production of rum and cane spirits, accounted
for the remaining 45%. Citrus juice concentrate is the primary raw material
used in the Company&#146;s winery operations. The Company purchases such raw
materials from a variety of suppliers. The Company purchases distilled
products, used in its bulk alcohol products and bottling operations businesses,
from several suppliers. Glass bottles and other materials, such as caps, labels
and cardboard cartons, are used in bottling and packaging and, with the
exception of glass bottles, are available from numerous suppliers.&#160; Alcohol and grape juice concentrate are the
primary raw materials used in the Company&#146;s vinegar and cooking wine
operations.&#160; As more fully described
below, during Fiscal 2005, two suppliers each accounted for more than 10% of
all of the Company&#146;s raw material purchases.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company purchases the majority of its glass bottle requirements from Saxco
International,&nbsp;Inc. Glass bottle costs are one of the largest components
of the Company&#146;s cost of goods sold.&#160; The
glass bottle industry is highly concentrated with only a small number of
producers.&#160; The Company has decided to
utilize one supplier for cost-based reasons.&#160;
The inability of the Company&#146;s glass bottle supplier to satisfy the
Company&#146;s requirements could adversely affect the Company&#146;s operations,
although the Company could shift its business to one or more other suppliers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company uses cane molasses as a raw material for the production of rum at its
facilities in St. Croix, United States Virgin Islands.&#160; The Company purchases its cane molasses raw
material requirements through Westway Trading Corporation, a broker that
specializes in the South American and Caribbean molasses markets.&#160; This arrangement is beneficial to the Company
in securing a higher quality molasses at lower prices than the Company could
obtain by going directly to the individual molasses suppliers.&#160; Based on an analysis of the world-wide cane
molasses market provided to the Company by the Company&#146;s molasses broker,
management believes that</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">there are adequate supplies of cane molasses available to meet the
Company&#146;s cane molasses raw material requirements, and the Company could, shift
its business to one or more other suppliers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Due to
the effects of hurricanes on the Florida citrus crop in 2004 and 2005, the
Company&#146;s supply of citrus molasses was not sufficient to meet its citrus
alcohol requirements in 2005 and may not be sufficient in 2006. However, during
2005, the Company was able to use alternative sources of raw material to meet
its citrus alcohol requirements. This alternative source has increased the
Company&#146;s production costs by approximately $0.5 million for certain of its
bulk citrus alcohol products.&#160; There can
be no assurance that the Company will be able to adequately source its citrus
alcohol raw material requirements at reasonable prices during 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fluctuations In
Operating Results; Seasonality</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
size and timing of purchase orders and product shipments can cause operating
results to fluctuate significantly from quarter to quarter, particularly since
some customers purchase bulk alcohol products in significant quantities at one
time or place significant orders at one time for contract bottling services,
distilled spirits, vinegar and cooking wine.&#160;
Additionally, some Company products generate higher profit margins than
others, and changes in the Company&#146;s product mix will therefore cause gross
margins to fluctuate.&#160; Certain aspects of
the Company&#146;s business are also seasonal, with increased demand for the Company&#146;s
contract bottling services from April&nbsp;to October&nbsp;and increased
production of the Company&#146;s bulk alcohol products from November&nbsp;to June,
corresponding to the Florida citrus harvest.&#160;
As a result of these factors, the Company&#146;s operating results may vary
significantly from quarter to quarter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Marketing and
Distribution</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Bulk
alcohol products are sold primarily in large quantities through
Company-employed salespeople. The Company&#146;s marketing strategy emphasizes the
cost advantages of these products over other ingredients available to end
producers. Bulk alcohol products are sold primarily to other bottlers,
distillers and end producers located in the United States and are exported to
approximately 20 foreign countries.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company manufactures, imports, exports and markets a variety of premium branded
spirits to wholesalers in the United States and internationally.&#160; The Company&#146;s marketing and promotional
programs for its premium brands are directed at consumers, retailers and
wholesalers and include consumer and trade print advertising, event
sponsorship, product sampling, in-store displays, price promotions,
point-of-sale materials and public relations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company sells private label products to wholesalers for distribution primarily
in the Southeastern United States. The Company&#146;s marketing strategy for these
products places primary emphasis upon the Company&#146;s cost advantages, directed
at wholesalers and retailers, rather than consumers. Wholesalers market these
products to retailers who then market them directly to consumers.&#160; Although competition for retail shelf space
in the beverage alcohol industry is significant, wholesalers of such products,
and not the Company, generally must address such competition.&#160; Sales of the Company&#146;s premium branded
spirits and private label products are generally made FOB (free on board) at
the Company&#146;s facilities and, accordingly, the purchasers of such products are
responsible for the risk of loss and transportation costs. In addition to its
own sales force, the Company works through various brokers to develop and
service its sales to wholesalers and retailers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s marketing strategy with respect to its contract bottling services
emphasizes the cost advantages and quality of the Company&#146;s services.
Arrangements with bottling customers are typically negotiated by the Company&#146;s
executive officers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Vinegar
and cooking wine are sold primarily in large quantities to manufacturers,
distributors and retailers through the Company&#146;s own sales force. These
products are also sold through wholesalers and directly to retailers under the
Company&#146;s private labels and the private labels of retailers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trademarks and
Distribution Agreements</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trademarks
are an important aspect of the Company&#146;s business.&#160; The Company sells its products under a number
of trademarks, which the Company owns or uses under license.&#160; The Company&#146;s important trademarks include
Cruzan Rum, Cruzan Estate Rum, Cruzan Flavored Rum, Ron Carlos Rum, Conch
Republic Rum and</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Edmundo Cooking Wine.&#160; Throughout
its segments, the Company also has various licenses and distribution agreements
for the sale, or the production and sale, of its products and products of third
parties.&#160; These licenses and distribution
agreements have varying terms and durations.&#160;
Agreements include, among others, import, marketing and distribution
agreements (&#147;Imported Spirits Distribution Agreements&#148;) with Antioqueno
Aguardiente, expiring in May&nbsp;2006, and Hine Cognac, which is a
year-to-year renewable arrangement for services to be performed by the
Company.&#160; The Company also has
distribution agreements with several third parties to distribute Cruzan Rum in
foreign countries, including a distribution agreement with V&amp;S to
distribute Cruzan products in the international spirits market.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All of
the Company&#146;s Imported Spirits Distribution Agreements may be terminated if the
Company fails to meet certain performance criteria.&#160; The Company believes it is currently in
compliance with all material terms of its Imported Spirits Distribution
Agreements.&#160; There can be no assurance
that these agreements will continue beyond their scheduled expiration dates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Competition</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
markets in which the Company&#146;s business segments operate are highly competitive
with respect to price, service and product quality, and there are several
companies with substantially greater financial and other resources than the
Company.&#160; The following is a summary of
the Company&#146;s main competitors, geographic area of operations and market share
for the Company&#146;s principal products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s bulk rum products compete primarily with two Caribbean rum producers,
West Indies Rum Distillery and Foursquare Distillery, both in Barbados.&#160; The Company competes with these other bulk
rum producers primarily in the United States, although the Company does sell
small quantities of bulk rum internationally.&#160;
Management believes that the Company is the largest supplier of bulk rum
in the United States based on reports of U.S. Imports for Consumption prepared
by the Department of Census and that the Company&#146;s market-share of bulk rum
products in the United States is approximately 90%.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s citrus brandy and citrus spirits products are sold in the United
States and management is aware of only one other domestic producer, Bartow
Ethanol Company.&#160; Management believes
that the Company is the largest supplier of bulk citrus brandy and citrus
spirits in the United States and that the Company&#146;s market share of citrus
brandy and citrus spirits in the United States is approximately 80% and 60%,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s cane spirits are sold in the United States.&#160; Management is not aware of any other domestic
producers of cane spirits and is not able to determine the Company&#146;s market
share for this product.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s fortified wine products are sold in the United States, and to a much
lesser extent, in Northern Europe.&#160;&#160;
Although management is aware of only two other producers of citrus-based
fortified wine, Meier&#146;s Wine Cellars,&nbsp;Inc. and Alko,&nbsp;Inc.
(Netherlands), there are several producers of grape-based fortified wine that
compete with the Company&#146;s fortified wine products.&#160; Some producers of grape-based fortified wine
include Golden State Vintners,&nbsp;Inc., Constellation Brands and Mogen David.
&#160;Management is not able to determine the
number of competitors for the Company&#146;s fortified wine products or the Company&#146;s
share of the fortified wine market.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s premium branded spirits products, primarily Cruzan Estate Rums and
Cruzan Flavored Rums, are sold in the United States and 13 other countries
internationally.&#160; The Company&#146;s premium
branded spirits products compete against other distilled spirits products,
including premium labels, mid-price and popular-price products.&#160; The Company&#146;s largest competitors in this
segment are Bacardi,&nbsp;Inc. (Bacardi Rum), Diageo (Captain Morgan Rum),
Pernod Ricard (Malibu Rum) and Remy Cointreau (Mount Gay Rum).&#160; Each of these competitors has greater
financial resources than the Company.&#160;
Based on data published in the Impact Databank and Adams Liquor
Handbook, management estimates that the Company has less than a 1% share of the
distilled spirits market in the United States and a 2% share of the United
States rum market.&#160; The Company&#146;s premium
branded spirits products compete with those of companies for whom the Company
performs contract bottling services and to whom the Company sells its bulk
alcohol products. The Company believes that its relationships with its
customers are good, and it has not experienced any adverse effects, such as
termination or non-renewal of ongoing contracts, as a result of competition. In
addition, the Company does not expect to experience any material adverse
effects from such competition in the foreseeable future.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='8',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s private label products compete mainly in the Southeastern United
States against other distilled spirits products, including premium labels,
mid-price and popular-price products.&#160;&#160;
The Company&#146;s main competitors for its private label products include
Heaven Hill Distillers, Barton Brands, Ltd., LeVecke Corporation and McCormick
Distilling.&#160; Management is not able to
determine the Company&#146;s market share for these products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s contract bottling operations compete against other bottlers located
throughout the Southeastern United States. Management is not able to determine
the number of other competitors or its market share for these services.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160; </font>The
Company&#146;s vinegar products are sold primarily in the Southeast and Midwest
United States.&#160; In the United States, the
vinegar industry is dominated by two large manufacturers, Mizkan and Fleishman,
with approximately 20 vinegar plants, and there are about ten smaller manufacturers,
