including National Vinegar and Creole Fermentation, with an aggregate of
approximately 24 vinegar plants.&#160;
Management is not able to determine the Company&#146;s market share of
vinegar products.&#160; Since vinegar is a low
margin commodity, the sale of vinegar is limited to within a small radius of a
particular manufacturing plant due to the cost of shipping to the
customer.&#160; Therefore, with the exception
of certain higher margin specialty vinegars which are sold throughout the
United States, the majority of the Company&#146;s vinegar products are only
competitive within a limited radius of the Company&#146;s manufacturing facility,
generally 200 to 500 miles.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s higher margin cooking wine products are sold throughout the United
States and Canada.&#160; The Company&#146;s
competitors for its cooking wine products include Canandaigua Wine Company, San
Antonio Winery, Gibson Winery and Heck Cellars.&#160;
Although published data is not available, management is not aware of any
competitors of the Company&#146;s size and believes that the Company is the largest
supplier of cooking wine in the United States.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Regulation and
Taxation</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau of the United States Treasury
Department regulates the wine and spirits industry with respect to production,
blending, bottling, sales, advertising and transportation of alcohol
products.&#160; Also, each state regulates
advertising, promotion, transportation, sale and distribution of alcohol
products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant
to federal and state environmental requirements, the Company is required to
obtain permits and licenses to operate certain facilities, and to treat and
remove effluents discharged from its distilling, winery and bottling
operations. Management believes it is presently in material compliance with all
applicable federal and state regulations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Beverage
alcohol produced and bottled by the Company is subject to federal excise taxes.
As of September&nbsp;30, 2005, excise taxes were being imposed at flat rates of
$13.50 per proof gallon for distilled spirits and $1.57 per gallon for
fortified wine.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s
fortified wine products, as an ingredient of beverage alcohol, have a cost
advantage under the component method of taxation, which taxes wine at a lower
rate than distilled spirits. Changes in, or the elimination of, the component
method of taxation, as it relates to wine, could have a material adverse effect
on the Company&#146;s results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Employees</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of September&nbsp;30,
2005, the Company had approximately 390 full-time employees. Additional workers
are generally employed at the Company&#146;s bottling facilities during the summer
months, when the bulk of contract bottling takes place. None of the Company&#146;s
employees is a member of any labor union, nor are there any collective
bargaining agreements between the Company and its employees, with the exception
of 36 of the Company&#146;s 56 United States Virgin Islands employees.&#160; Management believes that its relations with
its employees are good.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Information about
Foreign and Domestic Operations and Export Sales</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company has facilities in Florida and Kentucky for the production of bulk
alcohol products, premium branded spirits, contract bottling services, vinegar
and cooking wine.&#160; The Company sells its
products and services</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">primarily to customers in the United States but also exports certain
products to foreign countries, primarily in Europe, Canada, Central America and
the Caribbean.&#160; The Company&#146;s rum
production facilities are located in St. Croix, United States Virgin
Islands.&#160; Bulk rum produced in the Virgin
Islands is sold primarily to other bottlers of rum, producers of beverage
alcohol, food companies and flavor manufacturers located in the United States,
but is also sold to foreign countries in the Caribbean, South America and
Europe.&#160; See Note 13 to the Company&#146;s
consolidated financial statements for additional information about the Company&#146;s
foreign and domestic operations and export sales.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 1A.&#160; Risk Factors</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Risks That May&nbsp;Affect
Future Results</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In
addition to the risks and uncertainties of ordinary business operations,
important factors that could cause our actual results to differ materially from
those contained in or implied by any forward-looking statements contained in
this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K include:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">We face
competition that may reduce our market share and margins.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We are in a highly competitive industry and the
dollar amount and unit volume of our sales could be negatively affected by:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">our
inability to maintain or increase prices,</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">changes in
geographic or product mix,</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">a general
decline in beverage alcohol consumption, or</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="color:black;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="3" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font color="black" style="color:windowtext;">the
decision of wholesale customers, retailers or consumers to purchase competitors&#146;
products instead of our products.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Since March&nbsp;2003, no less than four of our
largest competitors &#150; Bacardi, Diageo, Allied Domecq and Pernod Ricard &#150; have
introduced competitive flavored rum product offerings.&#160; Each of these competitors has greater
financial resources than we do.&#160;
Wholesaler, retailer and consumer purchasing decisions are influenced
by, among other things, the perceived absolute or relative overall value of our
products, including their quality or pricing, compared to competitive
products.&#160; Unit volume and dollar sales
could also be affected by pricing, purchasing, financing, operational, advertising
or promotional decisions made by wholesalers, state and provincial agencies,
and retailers, which could affect their supply of, or consumer demand for, our
products.&#160; We could also experience
higher than expected selling, general and administrative expenses if our
management finds it necessary to increase the number of personnel or
advertising or promotional expenditures to maintain our competitive position or
for other reasons.&#160; Increased competition
and unanticipated actions by competitors or customers could lead to downward
pressure on prices and/or a decline in our market share, which would adversely
affect our results and hinder our growth potential.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Our bottling
operations have declined in recent fiscal years, and may continue to decline.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales of our bottling operations were $13.0
million, $11.9 million and $14.3 million for Fiscal 2005, 2004 and 2003,
respectively.&#160; During the first quarter
of Fiscal 2004, we lost a large private label-bottling customer that accounted
for approximately 17.6% of our bottling operations net sales and 5.2% of our
bottling operations volume.&#160; Sales in our
bottling operations have also declined as a result of a contraction in the
ready-to-drink product category, for which we are a contract bottler.&#160; Responding to this decline, in July&nbsp;2004,
we completed the partial consolidation of our bottling operations to reduce
overhead.&#160; However, bottling operations
volume did not even meet management&#146;s reduced expectations for Fiscal 2004,
which caused a continuing loss in this segment.&#160;
</font>We have been placing a renewed emphasis on the sales effort in
this segment, seeking other contract bottling opportunities.&#160; We have explored other alternatives in our
two bottling facilities, including further consolidation, a partial sale and
shedding less profitable product lines.&#160; </font>In December&nbsp;2004, management discontinued
production of all products in the Lake Alfred bottling plant with the exception
of one production line bottling vinegar, cooking wine and juices.&#160; In January&nbsp;2005, we reduced the
operation of this bottling line to one shift.&#160;
Management cannot assure that its efforts will be successful, or that
this segment will experience operating profits in the future.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Our premium branded
spirits segment has experienced, and may continue to experience, operating
losses as we reinvest our gross profit from that and other segments in our
selling, general and administrative expense for the premium branded spirits
segment.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales of our premium branded spirits segment,
which includes Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums, for Fiscal 2005
increased by 22.6% compared to Fiscal 2004.&#160;
However, during Fiscal 2005, our premium branded spirits segment&#146;s
operating losses only improved to $7.3 million from operating losses of $7.6
million in Fiscal 2004.&#160; These operating
losses reflect management&#146;s continuing efforts to increase market share by
reinvesting this and other segments&#146; gross profits in selling and marketing
expenses for the premium branded spirits segment</font> in an effort to support
the continued growth of our Cruzan brand.&#160;
Management intends to continue its increased expenditures in 2006 to
maintain the growth of the Cruzan brand.&#160;
</font>We cannot assure that our
increased selling and marketing efforts will be successful, or that this
segment will experience operating profits in the future.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">The seasonality of
our business and the timing of orders could cause operating results to
fluctuate.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
size and timing of purchase orders and product shipments can cause our
operating results to fluctuate significantly from quarter to quarter,
particularly since some customers purchase bulk alcohol products in significant
quantities at one time or place significant orders at one time for contract
bottling services, vinegar and cooking wine.&nbsp; Additionally, some of our
products generate higher profit margins than others, and changes in our product
mix will therefore cause gross margins to fluctuate.&nbsp; Certain aspects of
our business are also seasonal, with increased demand for our contract bottling
services from April&nbsp;to October&nbsp;and increased production of some of
our bulk alcohol products from November&nbsp;to June, corresponding to the
Florida citrus-harvest.&nbsp; As a result of these factors, our operating results
may be erratic, varying significantly from quarter to quarter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Our dependence on
distribution channels may limit our ability to sell our products.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We sell our private label products and premium
branded spirits principally to wholesalers for resale to retail outlets,
including package liquor stores and restaurants.&#160; The replacement or poor performance of our
principal wholesalers or our inability to collect accounts receivable from our
principal wholesalers could materially and adversely affect our results of
operations and financial condition.&#160;
Distribution channels for alcoholic beverages have been characterized in
recent years by rapid change, including consolidations of certain wholesalers.&#160; Wholesalers and retailers of our products
offer products which compete directly with our products for retail shelf space
and consumer purchases.&#160; Accordingly,
there is a risk that these wholesalers or retailers may give higher priority to
competitor products.&#160; We cannot assure
that our wholesalers and retailers will continue to purchase our products or
provide our products with adequate levels of promotional support.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">We must maintain a
relatively large inventory of our products to support customer delivery
requirements, and if this inventory becomes obsolete and we are required to
write down our inventory, our operating results would be adversely affected.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We must maintain a relatively large inventory to meet
customer delivery requirements for our products, including those in our bulk
alcohol, premium branded spirits, bottling operations, and vinegar and cooking
wine segments. Inventory may become obsolete as we and our customers introduce
new products, cease to produce old products, or modify the design of a product&#146;s
packaging. We maintain a provision for inventory obsolescence to cover
potential write-downs in inventory for obsolescence, but we cannot assure that
this provision is adequate, and inventory obsolescence could harm our operating
results.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">An increase in
excise taxes or government regulations could have a material adverse effect on
our business.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the United States and other countries in which we
operate, we are subject to the imposition of excise and other taxes on beverage
alcohol products in varying amounts which have been subject to change. &#160;Significant increases in excise or other taxes
on beverage alcohol products could materially and adversely affect our
financial condition or results of operations.&#160;
Many states have considered proposals to increase, and some of these
states have increased, state alcohol excise taxes.&#160; In addition, federal, state, local and
foreign governmental agencies extensively regulate the beverage alcohol
industry concerning such matters as licensing, trade and pricing practices,
permitted and required labeling, advertising and relations with wholesalers and
retailers.&#160; Certain federal and state
regulations</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">11</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">also require warning labels and signage.&#160; New or revised regulations or increased
licensing fees, requirements or taxes could also have a material adverse effect
on our financial condition or results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">A decline in the
consumption of products we sell could adversely affect our sales revenues or
margin.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There have been periods in the past in which there
were substantial declines in the overall per capita consumption of beverage
alcohol products in the United States and other markets in which we
operate.&#160; A limited or general decline in
consumption in one or more of our product categories could occur in the future
due to a variety of factors, including:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>a decline in the popularity of flavored
spirits;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>demographic and social trends, changes in
travel, vacation or leisure activity patterns and a downturn in economic
conditions;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>increased concern about the health
consequences of consuming beverage alcohol products and about drinking and
driving;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>increased activity of anti-alcohol consumer
groups;&#160; and</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>increased federal, state or foreign excise or
other taxes on beverage alcohol products.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any
decline in the consumption of products we sell could have a significant adverse
effect on our sales revenue or margin.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">A small number of
customers account for a high percentage of our net sales and if we lose a few
customers or are unable to attract new customers, our net sales could decline.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Our bulk alcohol, contract bottling services and
private label products are sold to a relatively small number of customers and
we have large customers for vinegar and cooking wine.&#160; The loss of a few of these customers could
have a material adverse effect on our liquidity and results of operations.&#160; For example, our net sales for our bottling
operations decreased 16.6% between Fiscal 2003 and Fiscal 2004, and 23.5%
between Fiscal 2002 and Fiscal 2003 largely because of the loss of two large
customers.&#160; We cannot assure that we will
not lose other customers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We expect that sales of certain products to a small
number of customers will continue to account for a high percentage of our net
sales for the foreseeable future.&#160; For
example, for Fiscal 2005, 2004 and 2003, our top 10&nbsp;customers accounted
for approximately 28%, 43% and 58%, respectively, of our total net sales.&#160; Our future success depends on our ability to
retain our current customers, and to attract new customers.&#160; The loss of one or several customers, whether
through termination of agreements, acquisitions or bankruptcy, could
significantly reduce our net sales.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Changes in the
regulatory environment for the operation of our business or those of our
customers could pose risks and increased expenses.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and new rules&nbsp;subsequently
implemented by the Commission have required changes in corporate governance
practices of public companies.&#160; In
addition to final rules&nbsp;and rule&nbsp;proposals already made by the
Commission, the American Stock Exchange has adopted revisions to its
requirements for listed companies.&#160; We
continue to review all of our accounting policies and practices, legal
disclosure and corporate governance policies under the new legislation,
including those related to our relationships with our independent auditors,
enhanced financial disclosures, internal controls, board and board committee
practices, corporate responsibility and loan practices, and we intend fully to
continue to comply with such laws.&#160;
Management expects these new rules&nbsp;and regulations to make it more
difficult for us to attract and retain qualified executive officers and
qualified members of our Board of Directors, particularly to serve on the
various committees of the Board, including and in particular, the audit
committee.&#160; In addition, compliance with
new rules&nbsp;imposed by the Commission and the American Stock Exchange will
likely cause us to incur increased expenses, including legal and accounting
expenses.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">12</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">If we do not
successfully address the risks inherent in selling to international customers,
our net sales and financial results could decline.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">We derived 5% of our net sales from international
sales in Fiscal 2005 and 8% in Fiscal 2004.&#160;
Management plans to expand net sales and to grow our international
operations.&#160; We have limited experience
in international sales and may not be </font>able</font> to compete or operate effectively in international markets.&#160; We face certain risks inherent in conducting
business internationally, including:</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>fluctuations in currency exchange rates and
imposition of currency exchange controls;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>language and translation issues;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>difficulties in collecting accounts receivable
and longer collection periods;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>changes in regulatory requirements;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>political and economic instability; and</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>potential adverse tax consequences.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Any of these factors could harm our international
sales and, consequently, our business and operating results.&#160; Specifically, failure to successfully manage
international growth could result in higher operating costs than anticipated or
could delay or preclude altogether our ability to generate net sales in key
international markets.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">We have a material
amount of goodwill and adverse results in operations could result in a
write-down of goodwill, which would further adversely affect our results of
operations.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of September&nbsp;30, 2005, goodwill represented
approximately $20.5 million, or 15% of our total assets.&#160; Goodwill is the amount by which the costs of
an acquisition accounted for using the purchase method exceeds the fair value
of the net assets acquired.&#160; We adopted
Statement of Financial Accounting Standard No.&nbsp;142 (&#147;SFAS No.&nbsp;142&#148;), &#147;Goodwill
and Other Intangible Assets,&#148; in its entirety, on October&nbsp;1, 2001.&#160; Under SFAS No.&nbsp;142, goodwill is no
longer amortized, but instead is subject to a periodic impairment evaluation
based on the fair value of the reporting unit.&#160;
Reductions in our net income caused by a write-down of goodwill could
materially and adversely affect our results of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Adverse public
opinion about alcohol may harm our business.</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">In recent years there has been substantial publicity
regarding the possible health benefits of moderate alcohol consumption.&#160; The results of a number of studies suggest
that moderate consumption of beverage alcohol could result in decreased
mortality, lower risk of cardiovascular disease, and other health benefits.&#160; Alternatively, anti-alcohol groups have, in
the past, successfully advocated more stringent labeling requirements and other
regulations designed to discourage consumption of beverage alcohol.&#160; More restrictive regulations, negative
publicity regarding alcohol consumption, publication of studies that indicate a
</font>significant</font> health risk
from moderate consumption of alcohol or changes in consumer perceptions of the
relative healthfulness or safety of beverage alcohol generally could adversely
affect the sale and consumption of alcohol and the demand for beverage alcohol
and could have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition,
and results of operations.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 1B.&#160; Unresolved Staff Comments</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Not
applicable.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 2.&#160; Properties</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company owns all of its principal production facilities, including all related
land, buildings, and equipment. The Lake Alfred facility consists of four
principal buildings with approximately 250,000 total square feet on 32 acres.
The Auburndale facility consists of three principal buildings with
approximately 250,000 total square feet on 16 acres. The Louisville facility
consists of three principal buildings with approximately 60,000 total square
feet on 27.5 acres. The Winter Haven facility consists of five principal
buildings with approximately 260,000 total square feet on 27.5 acres. The
Virgin Islands facility consists of 11 principal buildings with approximately
140,000 total square feet on 33 acres.&#160;
The Company leases approximately 10,000 square feet of office space in</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">West Palm Beach, Florida for its executive offices and 2,600 square
feet of office space in Jupiter, Florida for its marketing operations.&#160; Management believes that all of its
facilities, both owned and leased, are adequate and suitable for operations in
the foreseeable future.&#160; However,
management may undertake the expansion of certain facilities from time to time
in the ordinary course of business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 3.&#160; Legal Proceedings</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company and its subsidiaries are subject to litigation from time to time in the
ordinary course of business.&#160; None of
these routine legal proceedings are material.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item </font></b>4.&#160; Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security
Holders</h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No
matters were submitted to security holders during the fourth quarter of Fiscal
2005.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">14</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='14',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;II</font></b></h1>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 5.&#160; Market for Registrant&#146;s Common Equity,
Related Stockholder Matters and Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s Common Stock trades on the American Stock Exchange under the symbol &#147;RUM.&#148;&#160; Table 1 below sets forth the high and low
closing quotations of the Company&#146;s Common Stock for each quarter during the
two most recent fiscal years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

Low Quotations of the Company&#146;s Common Stock</font></b></h2>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.02%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">13.91</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

 </tr>

  <td width="35%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:35.78%;">

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
number of stockholders of record as of December&nbsp;2, 2005 was 22.&#160; In addition, based upon a list of
non-objecting beneficial owners, there were at least 435 beneficial owners.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No
dividends were paid to stockholders during Fiscal 2004 and Fiscal 2005. The
Company intends to continue to retain earnings for use in its business and,
therefore, does not anticipate declaring or paying cash dividends in the
foreseeable future.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 6.&#160; Selected Financial Data</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
selected financial data in Table 2 below are derived from the Company&#146;s audited
consolidated financial statements. These data are qualified by reference to,
and should be read in conjunction with, the consolidated financial statements
and related notes and &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial
Condition and Results of Operations&#148; included elsewhere herein.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 7.&#160; Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of
Financial Condition and Results of Operations</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Introduction</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management&#146;s
discussion and analysis of financial condition and results of operations
contains &#147;forward-looking statements.&#148;&#160;
See &#147;Introductory Note&#148; on page&nbsp;1.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following discussion and analysis summarizes the significant factors affecting (i)&nbsp;consolidated
results of operations of the Company for Fiscal 2005 compared to Fiscal 2004,
and Fiscal 2004 compared to Fiscal 2003, and (ii)&nbsp;financial liquidity and
capital resources for Fiscal 2005.&#160; This
discussion and analysis should be read in conjunction with the Company&#146;s consolidated
financial statements and notes thereto included herein.&#160; Certain amounts presented in this Item 7 have
been rounded to the nearest thousand and hundred thousand, as applicable, but
the percentages are based on actual amounts without rounding.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company operates primarily in the beverage alcohol industry in the United
States.&#160; The Company reports its
operating results in four segments:&#160; Bulk
Alcohol Products (rum, citrus brandy, citrus spirits, cane spirits, fortified
citrus wine, purchased distilled products and byproducts); Premium Branded
Spirits (primarily Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums); Bottling
Operations (contract bottling services and private label products); and Vinegar
and Cooking Wine (bulk vinegar, bulk cooking wine, vinegar stock and private
label case goods).</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='16',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Information
regarding net sales, operating income (loss) and total assets of each of the
Company&#146;s business segments and information regarding geographic areas is set
forth in Note 13 to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial statements located in
Item 8 of this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Tables
3 and 4 below set forth statement of operation items as a percentage of net
sales and information on net sales, gross profit (loss) and operating income
(loss) by operating segment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.32%;">

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.56%;">

 <tr>
  <td width="44%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:44.14%;">

  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.9</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.6%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.1</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.22%;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="44%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:44.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net income (loss)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.28%;">

  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.56%;">

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.62%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.74%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3,579</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.62%;">

  <td width="14%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.06%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6,065</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.16%;">

</table>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">17</font></p>

</font></div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Table
5 below provides unit sales volume data for certain Company products.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
