  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.3%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.46%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="44%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:44.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Bulk, in gallons</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.32%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2,831</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.3%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2,620</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.3%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4,212</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.46%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="44%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:44.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 20.0pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cases</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.32%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">569</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.3%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">634</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.54%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:15.3%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">615</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.46%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company is a leading producer and supplier of rum, brandy, wine and spirits to
other beverage alcohol manufacturers; produces, imports and markets premium
branded spirits; bottles beverage alcohol and other beverages on a contract
basis and under private labels; and produces vinegar and cooking wine.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s net sales and gross margins (gross profit as a percentage of net
sales) vary depending on the mix of business among the Company&#146;s products.&#160; Historically, gross margins have been highest
in bulk alcohol products and premium branded spirits and lower in bottling
operations and vinegar and cooking wine operations.&#160; Within its bottling operations, sales and
gross margins have varied substantially based upon the mix of business from the
Company&#146;s &#147;Type A&#148; and &#147;Type B&#148; bottling customers.&#160; Type A bottling customers pay the Company to
purchase their raw materials and these costs are passed through to the
customer.&#160; Type B bottling customers supply
their own raw materials and are only charged for bottling charges.&#160; Although gross profit per case for the
Company&#146;s Type A and Type B bottling customers is approximately equal, given
the same case volume, net sales and cost of goods sold with respect to products
bottled for Type A bottling customers are higher, and gross margins are lower,
than for Type B bottling customers.&#160; As a
result, significant fluctuations in volume of Type A bottling customers can
distort the Company&#146;s gross margin.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
size and timing of purchase orders and product shipments can cause operating
results to fluctuate significantly from quarter to quarter, particularly since
some customers purchase bulk alcohol products in significant quantities at one
time or place significant orders at one time for contract bottling services,
distilled spirits, vinegar and cooking wine.&#160;
Additionally, some Company products generate higher profit margins than
others, and changes in the Company&#146;s product mix will therefore cause gross
margins to fluctuate.&#160; Certain aspects of
the Company&#146;s business are also seasonal, with increased demand for the Company&#146;s
contract bottling services from April&nbsp;to October&nbsp;and increased
production of the Company&#146;s bulk alcohol products from November&nbsp;to June,
corresponding to the Florida citrus-harvest.&#160;
As a result of these factors, the Company&#146;s operating results may vary
significantly from quarter to quarter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
sales represent the Company&#146;s gross sales less excise taxes. Excise taxes are
generally payable on sales of certain of the Company&#146;s bulk alcohol products
and on all alcohol products bottled by the Company.&#160; However, there are no excise taxes paid on
sales made to customers that have tax permits.&#160;
Accordingly, excise taxes may vary significantly from period to period
depending upon the Company&#146;s product and customer mix.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='18',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Results of
Operations</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 align="left" style="color:black;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:left;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Fiscal 2005 Compared to Fiscal 2004</font></b></h4>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Net Sales</font></i></b>. Net sales
were $106.5 million in 2005, an increase of 10.4% from net sales of $96.4
million in 2004.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales
of bulk alcohol products were $40.4 million in 2005, an increase of 8.4% from
net sales of $37.2 million in 2004.&#160; The
increase resulted primarily from increased shipments of rum, citrus spirits and
fortified wine offset by decreased shipments of citrus brandy and cane
spirits.&#160; The decrease in citrus brandy
and cane spirits was due in part to the timing of customer orders and also due
to a market decline for these products.&#160; Management
believes that the Company&#146;s sales of citrus spirits have increased during 2005
due to a decrease in the recent market surplus of grape spirits which some of
the Company&#146;s customers may have been using as an alternative ingredient in
their product formulations.&#160; However,
management believes that this increase in business could be temporary and that
the Company&#146;s sales of citrus spirits could decrease in the future if the
market surplus of grape spirits increases.&#160;
In 2005, unit sales of citrus brandy and cane spirits decreased 4.3% and
18.0%, respectively, compared to 2004, and the average selling price of citrus
brandy decreased 2.6%.&#160; Also in 2005,
unit sales of the Company&#146;s rum and fortified wine products increased 3.0% and
7.9%, respectively, compared to 2004, and the average selling price for the
Company&#146;s rum increased 4.8% while the average selling price for fortified wine
decreased 2.0%.&#160; The average selling
prices for these bulk alcohol products varied due to changes in product and
customer mix.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
sales of premium branded spirits were $32.9 million in 2005, an increase of
22.6% from net sales of $26.8 million in 2004.&#160;
Sales of the Company&#146;s Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums
increased 21.3% in 2005 compared to 2004.&#160;
Sales of Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums increased from $2.2
million in Fiscal 1996 to $25.5 million in Fiscal 2005.&#160; During this time, the Cruzan brand has been
recognized as one of the fastest growing brands in the spirits industry by
certain beverage industry publications and the Cruzan Rums have won numerous
tasting awards from several prestigious beverage industry organizations.&#160; Since January&nbsp;2003, several of the
Company&#146;s competitors have introduced their own lines of flavored rum products
into the marketplace, which, in certain fiscal quarters, has negatively
impacted the level of sales growth of Cruzan Flavored Rums.&#160; Some of the Company&#146;s competitors in the rum
and flavored rum categories have significantly greater financial and other
resources than the Company, which could adversely affect the Company&#146;s sales
growth of Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums. As a response to such
increased competition, and in order to provide further impetus to the growth of
Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums, management significantly increased
its marketing budget in Fiscal 2004 and increased it again for Fiscal 2005 in
an effort to support the continued growth of the Company&#146;s Cruzan brand.&#160; This increase in marketing expenses has
increased the operating loss for this business segment in Fiscal 2005 and
Fiscal 2004.&#160; Management intends to
continue its increased expenditures in 2006 to maintain the growth of the
Cruzan Rum brand.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
sales of the Company&#146;s bottling operations were $13.0 million in 2005, an
increase of 9.0% from net sales of $11.9 million in 2004.&#160; While sales in the Company&#146;s bottling
operations increased 9.0% in 2005, unit volume decreased 15.4% and the average
price per case increased 28.9%.&#160; The
primary reason for the increase in the average price per case was the addition
in August&nbsp;2005 of a new Type A contract bottling customer for which the
Company supplies raw materials in addition to a bottling charge.&#160; Sales in the Company&#146;s bottling operations
have declined in recent fiscal years both as a result of a contraction in the
ready-to-drink product category, for which the Company is a contract bottler
and in the Company&#146;s private label business as a result of a loss of certain
large private label bottling customers.&#160;
Responding to this decline in business, in July&nbsp;2004 the Company
completed the partial consolidation of its bottling operations to reduce
overhead.&#160; However, bottling operations
volume did not even meet the Company&#146;s reduced expectations for 2004, which
caused a continuing loss in this segment.&#160;
The Company has been placing a renewed emphasis on the sales effort in
this segment while seeking other contract bottling opportunities.&#160; The Company has explored alternatives in its
two bottling facilities, including further consolidation, a partial sale and
shedding less profitable product lines.&#160;
In December&nbsp;2004, management discontinued production of all
products in the Lake Alfred bottling plant with the exception of one production
line bottling vinegar, cooking wine and juices.&#160;
In January&nbsp;2005, the operation of this bottling line was reduced to
one shift.&#160; At the present time, the
Company has not taken an impairment charge relating to its bottling operations
as the carrying value of its bottling assets is less than fair value.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
sales of vinegar and cooking wine were $20.2 million in 2005, a decrease of
1.0% from net sales of $20.4 million in 2004.&#160;
In 2005, total unit sales of vinegar and cooking wine decreased 3.9%
compared to 2004,</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='19',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">although the average selling price per unit increased 3.0%.&#160; The average selling prices of vinegar and
cooking wine increased due primarily to a combination of decreased sales of
lower priced white distilled vinegar and an increase in sales of higher priced
vinegar case goods.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Gross Profit</font></i></b>.&#160; Gross profit was $34.7 million in 2005, an
increase of 17.2% from gross profit of $29.6 million in 2004.&#160; During 2005, bulk alcohol gross profit
decreased $1.1 million primarily due to higher energy costs; premium branded
spirits gross profit increased $4.2 million due to sales increases; bottling
operations gross loss decreased $1.3 million due to reducing overhead as a
result of the Company&#146;s bottling consolidation plan and profit from a new
bottling contract of approximately $0.8 million; and vinegar and cooking wine
gross profit increased $0.7 million due to an improved product mix.&#160; Gross margin was 32.6% in 2005 and 30.8% in
2004.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Selling, General and
Administrative Expenses</font></i></b>.&#160;
Selling, general and administrative expenses were $38.3 million in 2005,
an increase of 15.3% from $33.2 million in 2004.&#160; The increase was primarily attributable to a
$4.1 million increase in administrative, marketing and advertising expenses in
the Company&#146;s premium branded spirits business in an effort to support the
continued growth of the Company&#146;s Cruzan brand.&#160;
Management intends to continue to increase selling, general and
administrative expenditures in 2006 to maintain the growth of its Cruzan Rum
brand.&#160; Also during 2005, the Company&#146;s
corporate overhead increased $0.8 million primarily due to professional fees
incurred as a result of the acquisition by V&amp;S of control of the Company.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Payment to be Made by Principal Stockholder</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">.&#160; </font></i>Pursuant
to a letter agreement entered into between Angostura and certain of the Company&#146;s
management on June&nbsp;2, 2005, Angostura agreed to pay to certain of the
Company&#146;s management an aggregate amount of $9 million if the sale of Angostura&#146;s
controlling interest in the Company to ASCI were completed.&#160; Although this sale was completed on September&nbsp;26,
2005, as of December&nbsp;16, 2005, this payment has not been made.&#160; This payment is not the obligation of the
Company and was negotiated between certain members of management and the former
majority owner without the participation of or ratification by the Company&#146;s
board of directors or any committee thereof and does not affect the Company&#146;s
balance sheet or cash flow statement.&#160;
However, under Staff Accounting Bulletin 107 issued by the Commission
relating to accounting for expenses or liabilities paid by principal
stockholder(s), this expected payment by Angostura was treated as an expense of
the Company in the statement of operations, and as a contribution to additional
paid-in capital on the balance sheet.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">&nbsp;</font></i></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Income (Loss)</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">.</font></i>&#160;
The following table sets forth the operating income (loss) by reportable
segment of the Company for 2005 and 2004.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="60%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.5in;width:60.02%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="48%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:48.12%;">

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(12,574</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.84%;">

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:right;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3,579</font></p>

 <tr height="0">
  <td width="216" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="13" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="1" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="89" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="13" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="9" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="1" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="86" style="border:none;"></td>
  <td width="13" style="border:none;"></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a
result of the above factors, operating loss was $12.6 million in 2005 and $3.6
million in 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s premium branded spirits segment experienced operating losses of $7.3
million in 2005 and $7.6 million in 2004.&#160;
The operating losses reflected the Company&#146;s continuing efforts to
increase market share by reinvesting this and other segments&#146; gross profits in
selling and marketing expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a
result of the factors described under &#147;Net Sales&#148; above, the Company&#146;s bottling
operations segment reported an operating loss of $3.1 million in 2005 and $3.9
million in 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Interest Expense</font></i>.</b>
Interest expense was $2.7 million in 2005 and $2.2 million in 2004.&#160; The Company&#146;s borrowing rates and average
borrowings were higher in 2005 compared to 2004.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='20',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income Tax Expense</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">.&#160; </font></i>During
2005 and 2004, the Company incurred operating losses from its U.S. operations
and recorded an income tax benefit of $3.9 million and $3.7 million,
respectively.&#160; The Company&#146;s Virgin
Islands subsidiary has a 90% exemption from U.S. Virgin Islands income
taxes.&#160; The exemption is effective
through September&nbsp;2020.&#160; In
addition, the Company benefited from the extraterritorial income exclusion in
2005 and 2004.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Fiscal 2004
Compared to Fiscal 2003</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Net Sales</font></i></b>. Net sales
were $96.4 million in 2004, an increase of 6.6% from net sales of $90.4 million
in 2003.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
sales of bulk alcohol products were $37.2 million in 2004, an increase of 5.8%
from net sales of $35.2 million in 2003.&#160;
The increase resulted primarily from increased shipments of rum and
fortified wine offset by decreased shipments of citrus brandy, citrus spirits
and cane spirits.&#160; The decrease in citrus
brandy, citrus spirits and cane spirits was due in part to the timing of
customer orders.&#160; In addition, in 2003,
the Company had sales of cane spirits to a new customer that had difficulty
sourcing bulk alcohol from its regular supplier.&#160; These sales of approximately $250,000 did not
reoccur in 2004.&#160; Management believes
that the Company&#146;s sales of citrus spirits declined approximately $176,000
during 2004 due to a market surplus of grape spirits which some of the Company&#146;s
customers may have been using as an alternative ingredient in their product
formulations.&#160; In 2004, unit sales of
citrus brandy and spirits decreased 7.2% and 23.8%, respectively, compared to
2003, and the average selling price of citrus brandy decreased 5.7%.&#160; Also in 2004, unit sales of the Company&#146;s
fortified wine products increased 17.4% compared to 2003, although the average
selling price for the Company&#146;s fortified wine decreased 3.4%.&#160; The average selling prices for these bulk
alcohol products decreased due to management lowering prices as a result of
increased competition from grape spirits distillers and foreign wine producers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
sales of premium branded spirits were $26.8 million in 2004, an increase of
29.0% from net sales of $20.8 million in 2003.&#160;
Sales of the Company&#146;s Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums
increased 24.1% in 2004 compared to 2003.&#160;
Sales of Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums increased from $2.2
million in Fiscal 1996 to $21.0 million in Fiscal 2004.&#160; During this time, the Cruzan brand has been
recognized as one of the fastest growing brands in the spirits industry by
certain beverage industry publications and the Cruzan Rums have won numerous
tasting awards from several prestigious beverage industry organizations.&#160; Since January&nbsp;2003, several of the
Company&#146;s competitors have introduced their own lines of flavored rum products
into the marketplace, which, in certain fiscal quarters, has negatively
impacted the level of sales growth of Cruzan Flavored Rums.&#160; Some of the Company&#146;s competitors in the rum
and flavored rum categories have significantly greater financial and other
resources than the Company, which could adversely affect the Company&#146;s sales
growth of Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums. As a response to such
increased competition, and in order to provide further impetus to the growth of
Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums, management significantly increased
its marketing budget for Fiscal 2004 in an effort to support the continued
growth of the Company&#146;s Cruzan brand, causing an increase in the operating loss
for this business segment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In August&nbsp;and
September&nbsp;2004, the eyes of three major hurricanes struck within
approximately thirty miles of all of the Company&#146;s facilities in Central
Florida.&#160; Physical damage to the Company&#146;s
facilities of less than $100,000 occurred as a result of these hurricanes.&#160; However, while difficult to quantify,
disruptions to business caused by these hurricanes, including several days of
plant shut-downs, prolonged loss of power, product shipment interruptions and
increased labor costs, contributed to lost sales in the premium branded spirits
segment, as well as to the additional costs in the bottling and vinegar and
cooking wine segments as discussed below.&#160;
The Company and its insurance advisor determined that the losses
incurred during these hurricanes, including physical damage and business
interruption, did not meet the deductible levels of the Company&#146;s casualty
insurance policies due mainly to the fact that each hurricane had a separate
deductible requirement and the Company&#146;s disruptions were incurred over the
course of all of the hurricanes, as well as the relatively minor physical
damage incurred.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
sales of the Company&#146;s bottling operations were $11.9 million in 2004, a
decrease of 16.6% from net sales of $14.3 million in 2003.&#160; During the first quarter of Fiscal 2004, the
Company lost a large private label bottling customer.&#160; Net sales to this private label bottling
customer were approximately $2.5 million and 193,719 cases for the year ended September&nbsp;30,
2003, or approximately 17.6% of bottling operations net sales and 5.2% of
bottling operations volume.&#160; Also during
2004, excise taxes decreased $4.8 million compared to 2003, primarily due to
the decrease in sales to this private label bottling customer.&#160; Sales in the Company&#146;s bottling operations
also continued to decline as a result of a contraction in the ready-to-drink
product category, for which the Company is a contract bottler.&#160; Responding to this decline, in July&nbsp;2004
the Company completed the partial consolidation of its</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='21',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744235\18427-1-ba-01.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:20 2006' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">bottling operations to reduce
overhead.&#160; However, bottling operations
volume did not even meet the Company&#146;s reduced expectations for 2004, which
caused a continuing loss in this segment.&#160;
The Company placed a renewed emphasis on the sales effort in this segment,
seeking other contract bottling opportunities.&#160;
The Company explored other alternatives in its two bottling facilities,
including further consolidation, a partial sale and shedding less profitable
product lines.&#160; In December&nbsp;2004,
management discontinued production of all products in the Lake Alfred bottling
plant with the exception of one production line bottling vinegar, cooking wine
and juices.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net sales of vinegar and cooking wine were
$20.4 million in 2004, an increase of 1.3% from net sales of $20.2 million in
2003.&#160; In 2004, total unit sales of
vinegar and cooking wine decreased 16.9% compared to 2003, although the average
selling price per unit increased 21.9%.&#160;
The average selling prices of vinegar and cooking wine increased due to
a combination of decreased sales of lower priced white distilled vinegar and
bulk cooking wine and a slight increase in sales of higher priced cooking wine
case goods.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Gross
Profit</font></i></b>.&#160;
Gross profit was $29.7 million in 2004, a decrease of 4.8% from gross
profit of $31.1 million in 2003.&#160; During
2004, bulk alcohol gross profit decreased $1.5 million as a result of higher
citrus molasses and citrus concentrate raw material costs; premium branded
spirits gross profit increased with sales; bottling operations gross profit
decreased with sales and increased costs as a result of hurricane disruptions;
and vinegar and cooking wine gross profit decreased $1.0 million due to higher
grain alcohol and citrus concentrate raw material cost and increased production
costs as a result of hurricane disruptions.&#160;
Gross margin was 30.8% in 2004 and 34.4% in 2003.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Selling, General and Administrative Expenses</font></i></b>.&#160; Selling, general and administrative expenses
were $33.2 million in 2004, an increase of 32.6% from $25.1 million in
2003.&#160; The increase was primarily
attributable to a $7.6 million increase in administrative, marketing and
advertising expenses in the Company&#146;s premium branded spirits business in an
effort to support the continued growth of the Company&#146;s Cruzan brand.&#160; Also during 2004, the Company&#146;s Compensation
and Stock Option Committee approved a new Supplemental Executive Retirement
Plan for certain key executives of the Company.&#160;
This new plan replaces a deferred compensation plan, which resulted in
the cancellation of a $0.7 million liability which was credited to selling,
general and administrative expenses.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Income (Loss)</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">.</font></i>&#160;
The following table sets forth the operating income (loss) by reportable
segment of the Company for 2004 and 2003.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.92%;">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4,190</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporate
  operations</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4,168</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="23%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:23.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(5,385</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="43%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:43.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:21.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3,579</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.98%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="21%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:21.36%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6,065</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="3%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:3.12%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the above factors, operating
loss was $3.6 million in 2004, as compared to operating income of $6.1 million
in 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s premium branded spirits segment
experienced operating losses of $7.6 million in 2004 and $2.3 million in
2003.&#160; The operating losses reflected the
Company&#146;s continuing efforts to increase market share by reinvesting this and
other segments&#146; gross profits in selling and marketing expenses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As a result of the factors described under &#147;Net
Sales&#148; above, the Company&#146;s bottling operations segment reported an operating
loss of $3.9 million in 2004 and $1.9 million in 2003.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Interest
Expense</font></i>.</b> Interest expense was $2.2 million in 2004
and $3.4 million in 2003.&#160; The Company&#146;s
borrowing rates and average borrowings were lower in 2004 compared to 2003.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Other
Expense</font></i></b>.&#160; On
November&nbsp;26, 2002, the Company announced the retirement and resignation of
A. Kenneth Pincourt,&nbsp;Jr., its Founder, Chairman and Chief Executive
Officer.&#160; The Company entered into a
retirement agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Pincourt, setting forth the terms of his
retirement and resignation.&#160; The
retirement agreement</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-03.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:14 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">replaced Mr.&nbsp;Pincourt&#146;s
previous employment agreement. Under the retirement agreement, the Company
elected to accelerate retirement benefits under its deferred compensation
program and to continue to pay compensation and provide related benefits
through July&nbsp;15, 2004, the remaining term of Mr.&nbsp;Pincourt&#146;s previous
employment contract.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accelerated benefits under the deferred
program amounted to $1,040,987, of which $549,220 had been accrued as of September&nbsp;30,
2002. Mr.&nbsp;Pincourt&#146;s deferred compensation was paid to him on December&nbsp;13,
2002.&#160; Also under the retirement
agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Pincourt continued to receive monthly payments of $41,004
through July&nbsp;15, 2004, one bonus payment of $150,491, which was paid in October&nbsp;2003,
and a second bonus payment of $119,138, which was paid in August&nbsp;2004.&#160; Among other benefits, Mr.&nbsp;Pincourt was
also able to participate in any health insurance plan, employee benefit plan or
other arrangement made available by the Company or its subsidiaries to its
executives and key management employees, through July&nbsp;15, 2004.&#160; The Company recorded a charge for the
retirement of Mr.&nbsp;Pincourt during 2003 and there were no charges with
respect to this in 2004.&#160; The effect of
this charge was included in other expense in the Company&#146;s consolidated
statement of operations and amounted to $1,503,925 before income taxes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table summarizes the charge
made during 2003 for Mr.&nbsp;Pincourt&#146;s retirement:</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.58%;">

  </td>

  <td width="10" style="border:none;"></td>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On May&nbsp;22, 2003, the Company announced
the retirement of Troy Edwards, its Chief Financial Officer, Secretary,
Treasurer and Controller.&#160; The Company
recorded a charge for the retirement of Mr.&nbsp;Edwards of $207,683 during the
third quarter of Fiscal 2003.&#160; The effect
of this charge was included in other expense in the Company&#146;s consolidated
statement of operations.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Income
Tax Expense</font></i></b><i><font style="font-style:italic;">.&#160; </font></i>During 2004 and 2003, the Company
incurred operating losses from its U.S. operations and recorded an income tax
benefit of $3.7 million and $1.0 million, respectively.&#160; The Company&#146;s Virgin Islands subsidiary has a
90% exemption from U.S. Virgin Islands income taxes.&#160; The exemption is effective through September&nbsp;2020.&#160; In addition, the Company benefited from the
extraterritorial income exclusion in 2004 and 2003.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financial
Liquidity and Capital Resources</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">General</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s principal use of cash in its
operating activities is for labor, overhead and raw materials to be used in its
manufacturing operations and purchasing imported products for its premium
branded spirits business.&#160; The Company&#146;s source of liquidity has
historically been cash flow from operations and its line of credit.&#160; Some of the Company&#146;s manufacturing
operations are seasonal and the Company&#146;s borrowings on its line of credit vary
during the year.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Florida citrus harvest is generally
during the months from November&nbsp;through June.&#160; The majority of the Florida citrus harvest is
processed as fresh fruit juice or juice concentrate.&#160; A byproduct of citrus juice production is
citrus molasses which the Company uses as a raw material at its two Florida
distilleries to produce citrus brandy and spirits.&#160; Due to the seasonal availability and short &#147;shelf-life&#148;
of the citrus molasses raw material, the Company produces its estimated annual
customer requirements during a seven-month period, and therefore, carries a
higher than normal level of inventory in relation to sales during this
seven-month period.&#160; Generally, the
Company&#146;s inventory level increases during this seven month period and
decreases after the citrus harvest ends when the Company supplies its customers
with citrus brandy and spirits from inventory from July&nbsp;through October.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There are no federal regulations that require
minimum aging to be designated rum. However, due to the Company&#146;s high quality
standards, the Company ages its Cruzan Estate Rums for two to five years and
certain of the Company&#146;s super premium rums are aged up to 12 years. Due to the
Company&#146;s own aging requirements,</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='23',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-03.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:14 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">production of Cruzan Estate
Rums is scheduled to meet demand two to three years in the future.&#160; Accordingly, inventories are larger in
relation to sales and total assets than for other branded spirits suppliers
that do not age their products. Management expects to continue to increase the
Company&#146;s inventory of barrel aged rums to meet projected increased sales in
the future.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Another seasonal business of the Company is
its contract bottling services.&#160; Demand
for contract bottling services is highest from April&nbsp;through October.&#160; During these months, the Company&#146;s
requirements increase for ingredients, glass bottles, caps, labels, packaging
materials and labor.&#160; During 2005, the
Company incurred losses from its bottling operations of $3.1 million.&#160; Management has explored alternatives for its
two bottling facilities, including further consolidation, a partial sale and
shedding less profitable product lines.&#160;
In December&nbsp;2004, management discontinued production of all
products in the Lake Alfred bottling plant with the exception of one production
line bottling vinegar, cooking wine and juices.&#160;&#160; In January&nbsp;2005, the operation of this
bottling line was reduced to one shift.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During 2005, management increased selling,
general and administrative expenses in its premium branded spirits segment in
an effort to support the continued growth of the Company&#146;s Cruzan brand.&#160; Management intends to continue its increased
expenditures in 2006 to maintain the growth of the Cruzan Rum brand.&#160; To the extent that the increased expenditures
do not result in increased sales of the Cruzan brand, the Company&#146;s short-term
liquidity may be adversely affected.&#160;
However, management actively monitors sales and expenditures on an
ongoing basis, and retains the ability to adjust its level of expenditures in
response to market conditions and in order to maintain sufficient liquidity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Management believes that cash provided by its
operating and financing activities will provide adequate resources to satisfy
its working capital, liquidity and anticipated capital expenditure requirements
for both its short-term and long-term capital needs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Operating
Activities</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash used in operating activities in 2005
was $3.7 million, which resulted from $0.7 million in net loss adjusted for noncash items, and a
$3.0 million net change in operating assets and liabilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investing and
Financing Activities</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash used in investing activities in 2005
was $0.6 million, including capital expenditures of $3.4 million partially offset by principal
payments received on notes receivable of $3.2 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net cash provided by financing activities in
2005 was $4.2 million, which resulted primarily from a $3.1 million net increase in borrowings under the
revolving credit facility and&#160; $5.5
million from the issuance of common stock off-set by $4.2 million of payments
on long-term debt.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In October&nbsp;2001, the Company entered
into a $70 million credit agreement with Wachovia Bank, consisting of a $40
million term loan and a $30 million revolving loan facility.&#160; In March&nbsp;2004, the revolving loan
facility was reduced to $15 million.&#160; The
credit agreement was due to expire in January&nbsp;2006.&#160; On December&nbsp;14, 2005, the Company
entered into a loan arrangement with V&amp;S consisting of a $30 million term
promissory note and a $10 million revolving promissory note, both of which are
unsecured, bear interest at the applicable LIBOR rate plus 90 basis points and
mature on December&nbsp;15, 2006.&#160; The
notes are non-amortizing and have no financial covenant requirements.&#160; On December&nbsp;16, 2005, the Company used
the proceeds of these notes to refinance its existing credit agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s bank debt was $28.6 million as
of September&nbsp;30, 2005, and its ratio of total debt to equity was 0.60 to
1.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s share of the undistributed
earnings of its Bahamian and Virgin Islands subsidiaries was approximately
$47.5 million as of September&nbsp;30, 2005.&#160;
No provision has been made for taxes which would result from the remittance
of such undistributed earnings, as the Company intends to reinvest these
earnings indefinitely. See Note 10 to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial
statements for additional information on income taxes related to these
subsidiaries.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">24</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-03.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:14 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based on current plans and business
conditions, management expects that its cash and cash equivalents, together
with any amounts generated from operations and available borrowings, will be
sufficient to meet the Company&#146;s cash requirements for at least the next 12
months.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Critical
Accounting Policies</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s significant accounting policies
are more fully described in Note 1 to the Company&#146;s consolidated financial
statements located in Item 8 of this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K. The
preparation of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles
generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to make
estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets, liabilities,
revenues, and expenses, and the related disclosures of contingent assets and
liabilities. Actual results could differ from those estimates under different assumptions
or conditions. The Company believes that the following critical accounting
policy is subject to estimates and judgments used in the preparation of its
consolidated financial statements:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has goodwill and intangible
assets associated with business acquisitions. The Company reviews these assets
for impairment annually and whenever an event occurs or circumstances change
that would more likely than not reduce the fair value of these assets below
their carrying value. If the fair value of these assets is less than their
carrying value, then an impairment loss would be recognized equal to the excess
of the carrying value over the fair value of the asset.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Off Balance Sheet
Arrangements</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has no off-balance sheet
arrangements that have or are reasonably likely to have a current or future
effect on the Company&#146;s financial condition, changes in financial condition,
revenues or expenses, results of operations, liquidity, capital expenditures or
capital resources that are material to investors.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">25</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .25in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">a)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
above table does not include variable rate interest payments on the Company&#146;s
long-term debt obligations.&#160; The estimated
variable rate interest payments on the Company&#146;s long-term debt are: $924,117
within one year; and $924,117 within two to three years.&#160; These payments are based on the rates in
effect as of December&nbsp;16, 2005, and assume an average of $6 million
outstanding under the revolving note, $30 million under the term note, with all
long-term debt maturing on December&nbsp;15, 2006.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effects of
Inflation and Changing Prices</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s results of operations and
financial condition have not been significantly affected by inflation and
changing prices.&#160; The Company has been
able, subject to normal competitive conditions, to pass along rising costs
through increased selling prices.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">26</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:6.04%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">

  </td>

  </td>
