</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company carries certain variable rate
debt and thus is exposed to the impact of interest rate changes.&#160; The table above summarizes the Company&#146;s
market risk associated with debt obligations as of September&nbsp;30, 2005,
after giving effect to the Company&#146;s refinancing on December&nbsp;16, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the event of an adverse change in interest
rates, management would consider taking certain actions, such as an interest
rate hedge or swap, to further mitigate the Company&#146;s exposure.&#160; However, due to the uncertainty of the
actions that would be taken and their possible effects, this analysis assumes
no such actions.&#160; The Company had no
derivative financial instruments as of September&nbsp;30, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">See Note 9 to the Company&#146;s consolidated
financial statements for additional information related to Company&#146;s financing
arrangements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 8.&#160; Financial Statements and Supplementary Data</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The consolidated financial statements and
financial statement schedules of the Company and its subsidiaries, and the
report of independent registered public accounting firm, are listed at
Item&nbsp;15.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 9.&#160; Changes in and Disagreements with Accountants
on Accounting and Financial Disclosure</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 9A.&#160; Disclosure Controls and Procedures</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Evaluation of
Disclosure Controls and Procedures</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company maintains disclosure controls and
procedures (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13a-15(e)&nbsp;under the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;)) that are designed to
ensure that information required to be disclosed in the Company&#146;s reports under
the Exchange Act are recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the
time periods specified in the Commission&#146;s rules&nbsp;and forms, and that the
information is accumulated and communicated to the Company&#146;s management,
including the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, as
appropriate, to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure.&#160; In designing and evaluating the disclosure
controls and procedures, management recognized that any disclosure controls and
procedures, no matter how well designed and operated, can provide only
reasonable assurance of achieving the desired objectives, and management was
required to apply its judgment in evaluating the cost-benefit relationship of
possible disclosure controls and procedures.&#160;
The Company&#146;s management, with the participation of the Company&#146;s Chief
Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, has evaluated the effectiveness
of the design and operation of the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures
as of the end of the period covered by this report.&#160; Based upon that evaluation, the Company&#146;s
Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer concluded that the design
and operation of the Company&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures provided
reasonable assurance that the disclosure controls and procedures are effective
to accomplish their objectives.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">27</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Changes in
Internal Control Over Financial Reporting</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In addition, management, including the
Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, reviewed the
Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Rule&nbsp;13a-15(f)&nbsp;under
the Exchange Act), and there have been no changes in the Company&#146;s internal controls
during the fourth quarter of Fiscal 2005 that has materially affected, or is
reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company&#146;s internal control over
financial reporting.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 9B. Other
Information</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">None.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h1 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PART&nbsp;III</font></b></h1>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 10.&#160; Directors and Executive Officers of the
Registrant</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h4 style="color:black;font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">BOARD OF DIRECTORS, COMMITTEES AND
EXECUTIVE OFFICERS</font></b></h4>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

with respect to the directors and executive officers of the Company.</font></p>

</div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In accordance with the Company&#146;s Certificate
of Incorporation, the Board of Directors of the Company is divided into three
classes, designated Class&nbsp;I, Class&nbsp;II and Class&nbsp;III.&#160; The maximum number of members of the Board of
Directors is currently seven.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Class&nbsp;I
Directors (term expires &#150; 2008 Annual Meeting)</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Donald L. Kasun</font></b>
- - Mr.&nbsp;Kasun joined the Company as a director in December&nbsp;2001.&#160; Since 1978, Mr.&nbsp;Kasun has been president
of Kasun Development Corp., an industrial real estate development and
management company, and senior vice president of Southern Container Corp., a
privately-held manufacturer of paperboard and corrugated boxes.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Ola Salm&#233;n</font></b>
- - Mr.&nbsp;Salm&#233;n joined the Company as a director effective October&nbsp;11,
2005 and was appointed Chairman on December&nbsp;13, 2005.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Salm&#233;n has been Senior Vice
President Finance of V&amp;S since 2002.&#160;
Prior to joining V&amp;S, Mr.&nbsp;Salm&#233;n was Chief Financial Officer of
Adcore AB, a Swedish public IT consulting firm.&#160;
From 1997 until 2002, Mr.&nbsp;Salmen served as Financial Director and Director
of Risk Control for Handelsbanken Markets.&#160;
Mr.&nbsp;Salm&#233;n is a citizen of Sweden.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Class&nbsp;II
Directors (term expires &#150; 2006 Annual Meeting)</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Leonard G. Rogers</font></b>&nbsp;-
Mr.&nbsp;Rogers joined the Company as a director in 1992.&#160; He was Chairman of the Board of the Company
from 1974 to 1985 and since 1985 has been a private investor.&#160; From 1969 to 1974, Mr.&nbsp;Rogers was Senior
Vice President - Consumer Products Division for American conglomerate Gulf&nbsp;&amp;
Western Industries.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Mats Andersson</font></b>
- - Mr.&nbsp;Andersson joined the Company as a director effective October&nbsp;11,
2005.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Andersson has been Senior
Vice President Business Development of V&amp;S since 1999.&#160; Prior to serving in this capacity, Mr.&nbsp;Andersson
was the Vice President of the Wines Division of V&amp;S from 1994 through 1999.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Andersson is a citizen of Sweden.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Lisa Derman</font></b>
- - Ms.&nbsp;Derman joined the Company as a director effective October&nbsp;11,
2005.&#160; Ms.&nbsp;Derman has been the
General Counsel of ASCI since January&nbsp;2005.&#160; Prior to joining ASCI, Ms.&nbsp;Derman was
employed by Schieffelin&nbsp;&amp; Somerset, the national importer for Dom
Perignon, Hennessey, Tanqueray and Johnnie Walker, where she served as Senior
Counsel from July&nbsp;2001 to January&nbsp;2004.&#160; From 1994 to 2000, she was employed by the
national law firm McDermott Will&nbsp;&amp; Emery LLP as an associate or
consultant where she specialized in alcohol beverage regulatory law and
distributor relations.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Class&nbsp;III
Directors (term expires &#150; 2007 Annual Meeting)</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Edward F. McDonnell</font></b>
- - Mr.&nbsp;McDonnell joined the Company as a director in 1998.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;McDonnell is Chairman and Chief
Executive Officer of The Premier Group, a company he founded in 1995.&#160; The Premier Group owns beverage alcohol
distributing companies in the Caribbean, Philippines and South Pacific.&#160; Prior to founding The Premier Group, Mr.&nbsp;McDonnell
served with The Seagram Company Ltd. from 1981 in various executive capacities,
including as a director and Executive Vice President of The Seagram Company
Ltd. and President of The Seagram Spirits and Wine Group.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Ketil Eriksen</font></b>
- - Mr.&nbsp;Eriksen joined the Company as a director effective October&nbsp;11,
2005.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Eriksen has been
president of V&amp;S Absolut Spirits since January&nbsp;2005.&#160; Prior to joining V&amp;S, he was Chief
Executive Officer of Colgate-Palmolive Sweden&nbsp;&amp; Finland from May&nbsp;1999
to January&nbsp;2005.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Eriksen
is a citizen of Norway.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Executive Officers</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Certain information relating to each
executive officer of the Company (other than those set forth above) is set
forth below.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Jay S. Maltby</font></b>&nbsp;-
Mr.&nbsp;Maltby joined the Company in 1995 as President, Chief Operating
Officer and a director and was appointed as Chairman of the Board and Chief
Executive Officer in 2002.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Maltby
resigned from the Company&#146;s board of directors effective September&nbsp;30,
2005.&#160; Prior to joining the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Maltby
served with Bacardi Imports, Ltd. from 1978 in various executive capacities,
including as a member of Bacardi&#146;s Executive Committee and Vice President of
Finance and Operations.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Thomas A. Valdes</font></b>&nbsp;-
Mr.&nbsp;Valdes joined the Company in 1995 as Executive Vice President and,
prior to his resignation from our board of directors on September&nbsp;30,
2005, had been a director of the Company since 1996.&#160; Prior to joining the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Valdes
held various executive positions with Bacardi Imports, Ltd., a beverage alcohol
marketing company, from 1979, the latest of which was Vice President of
Marketing and Operations.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Ezra Shashoua</font></b> &#150; Mr.&nbsp;Shashoua
joined the Company as Executive Vice President, Chief Financial Officer and
Secretary in June&nbsp;2003.&#160; Prior to
joining the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Shashoua worked at NationsRent,&nbsp;Inc., a
national equipment rental chain, where he served as Executive Vice President
and Chief Financial Officer from January&nbsp;2001 to June&nbsp;2003.&#160; Prior to joining NationsRent, Mr.&nbsp;Shashoua
worked at 7-Eleven,&nbsp;Inc., a national convenience store chain, in Dallas,
Texas, where he served in various capacities of increasing responsibility from
1982 to January&nbsp;2001, the latest of which was Vice President and Chief
Financial Officer.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Shashoua
began his career as an attorney at Sonnenschein, Nath and Rosenthal in Chicago,
Illinois.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">D. Chris Mitchell</font></b>&nbsp;-
Mr.&nbsp;Mitchell joined the Company in 1984 as manager of the Company&#146;s
bottling operations.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Mitchell
was promoted to Vice President&nbsp;- Sales in 1989 and appointed as Senior
Vice President - Sales in 1994.&#160;&#160; Prior
to his resignation from the Company&#146;s board of directors, effective September&nbsp;30,
2005, Mr.&nbsp;Mitchell had been a director of the Company since 1991.&#160; Prior to joining the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Mitchell
was general manager of bottling operations for United States Distilled
Products, a beverage alcohol marketing company, from 1980 to 1984.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Ousik Yu</font></b>
- - Mr.&nbsp;Yu joined the Company in 1990 and served as Vice President -
Bottling Operations since that time until his appointment as Senior Vice
President - Beverage Division in 1994.&#160;
In 1996, Mr.&nbsp;Yu was appointed as Senior Vice President -
Manufacturing.&#160; From 1986 to 1989, Mr.&nbsp;Yu
was employed by Brown-Forman Corporation, a beverage alcohol manufacturing and
marketing company, most recently as manager of packaging/process
engineering.&#160; From 1981 to 1986, he was
employed in plant engineering by The Stroh&#146;s Brewery Company, a beverage
alcohol company.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">30</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='30',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-03.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:14 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Committees</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board of Directors has an Audit Committee
and a Compensation and Stock Option Committee.&#160;
The Board does not have a standing nominating committee or a charter
with respect to the process for nominating directors for election to the Company&#146;s
Board of Directors.&#160; The Company
qualifies as a &#147;controlled company&#148; under American Stock Exchange rules, as
ASCI controls more than 50% of the Company&#146;s voting power, as evidenced by the
Company&#146;s ownership records.&#160; As a
result, the American Stock Exchange continued listing standards do not require
the Company to have a nominating committee or a written charter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h5 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:normal;">Audit
Committee</font></i></b></h5>

<h5 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h5>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Audit Committee:&#160; (i)&nbsp;appoints the Company&#146;s independent
auditors and monitors the independence of the Company&#146;s independent auditors; (ii)&nbsp;reviews
the Company&#146;s policies and procedures on maintaining its accounting records and
the adequacy of its internal controls; (iii)&nbsp;reviews management&#146;s
implementation of recommendations made by the independent auditors and internal
auditors; (iv)&nbsp;considers and pre-approves the range of audit and non-audit
services performed by independent auditors and fees for such services; and (v)&nbsp;reviews
and votes on all transactions between the Company and any of its officers,
directors or other affiliates.&#160; The Audit
Committee held five meetings during Fiscal 2005.&#160; The Board of Directors has adopted a written
charter for the Audit Committee, which has been previously filed with the
Commission.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In Fiscal 2005, the Audit Committee consisted
of Donald L. Kasun, Leonard G. Rogers and Edward F. McDonnell.&#160; Messrs.&nbsp;Kasun, McDonnell and Rogers are &#147;independent,&#148;
satisfying the American Stock Exchange listing requirements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board has determined that Mr.&nbsp;Rogers,
one of the Company&#146;s independent directors, is an audit committee financial
expert as defined by Commission rules&nbsp;and is financially sophisticated as
defined by American Stock Exchange rules.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h5 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:normal;">Compensation
and Stock Option Committee</font></i></b></h5>

<h5 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h5>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation and Stock Option Committee
of the Board of Directors was established to determine the cash and other
incentive compensation, if any, to be paid to the Company&#146;s executive officers.
The Compensation and Stock Option Committee is also responsible for the
administration of and awards under the Company&#146;s 2004 Employee Stock Option
Plan (the &#147;2004 Option Plan&#148;).&#160; This
Committee met three times during Fiscal 2005.&#160;
This Committee currently consists of Messrs.&nbsp;Kasun and Rogers.&#160; Because the Company qualifies as a &#147;controlled
company&#148; under American Stock Exchange rules, the American Stock Exchange
continued listing standards regarding Executive Compensation are not applicable
to the Company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Shareholder
Nominations to Board of Directors</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Shareholders and members of the Company&#146;s
Board submit nominees for election to the Company&#146;s Board of Directors to the
entire Board for its consideration.&#160;
There have been no changes to the procedures by which stockholders may
recommend nominees to the Board of Directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s Bylaws contain provisions that
address the process by which a stockholder may nominate an individual to stand
for election to the Board of Directors at the Company&#146;s Annual Meeting of
Stockholders.&#160; Historically, the Company
has not had a formal policy concerning stockholder recommendations to the Board
of Directors.&#160; To date, other than from
Angostura and ASCI, the Company&#146;s former and current controlling stockholders,
respectively, the Company has not received any recommendations from
stockholders requesting that the Board consider a candidate for inclusion among
the slate of nominees in the Company&#146;s Proxy Statement.&#160; The absence of such a policy does not mean,
however, that a recommendation would not have been considered had one been
received.&#160; The Board would consider any
candidate proposed in good faith by a stockholder.&#160; To do so, a stockholder should send the
candidate&#146;s name, credentials, contact information, and his or her consent to
be considered as a candidate to the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer, Jay S.
Maltby.&#160; The proposing stockholder should
also include his or her contact information and a statement of his or her share
ownership (how many shares owned and for how long).</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">31</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-03.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:14 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In evaluating director nominees, the Board
considers the following factors:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
appropriate size of the Company&#146;s Board of Directors;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
needs of the Company with respect to the particular talents and experience of
its directors;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
knowledge, skills and experience of nominees, including experience in finance,
administration or public service, in light of prevailing business conditions
and the knowledge, skills and experience already possessed by other members of
the Board;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>familiarity
with the beverage alcohol industry;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>experience
in political affairs;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>experience
with accounting rules&nbsp;and practices; and</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="3" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:12.0pt;">&#149;</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>the
desire to balance the benefit of continuity with the periodic injection of the
fresh perspective provided by new Board members.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 1.0in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s goal is to assemble a Board of
Directors that brings together a variety of perspectives and skills derived
from high quality business and professional experience.&#160; In doing so, the Board will also consider
candidates with appropriate non-business backgrounds.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Other than the foregoing, there are no stated
minimum criteria for director nominees, although the Board of Directors may
also consider such other factors as it may deem are in the best interests of
the Company and its stockholders.&#160; The
Board does, however, believe it appropriate for at least one, and, preferably,
several, members of the Board to meet the criteria for an &#147;audit committee
financial expert&#148; as defined by Commission rules&nbsp;and for a &#147;financially
sophisticated&#148; audit committee member as defined by American Stock Exchange
rules.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board of Directors identifies nominees by
first evaluating the current members of the Board willing to continue in
service.&#160; Current members of the Board
with skills and experience that are relevant to the Company&#146;s business and who
are willing to continue in service are considered for re-nomination.&#160; If any member of the Board does not wish to
continue in service or if the Board decides not to re-nominate a member for
re-election, the Board then identifies the desired skills and experience of a
new nominee in light of the criteria above.&#160;
Current members of the Board of Directors are polled for suggestions as
to individuals meeting the criteria described above.&#160; The Board may also engage in research to
identify qualified individuals.&#160; To date,
the Company has not engaged third parties to identify or evaluate or assist in
identifying potential nominees, although the Company reserves the right in the
future to retain a third party search firm, if necessary.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;Beneficial
Ownership Reporting Compliance</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;of the Exchange Act
requires the Company&#146;s directors and executive officers, and anyone who
beneficially owns 10% or more of the Company&#146;s Common Stock, to file with the
Commission and the American Stock Exchange initial reports of beneficial
ownership and reports of changes in beneficial ownership of Common Stock.&#160; Such persons are required by regulations of
the Commission to furnish the Company with copies of all Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;forms
they file.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based solely upon on a review of (i)&nbsp;copies
of the Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;filings received by the Company during or with
respect to Fiscal 2005 and (ii)&nbsp;certain written representations of its
officers and directors with respect to the filing of annual reports of changes
in beneficial ownership on Form&nbsp;5, the Company believes that each filing
required to be made pursuant to Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;of the Exchange Act
during and with respect to Fiscal 2005 was filed in a timely manner, except
that the following individuals each filed a Form&nbsp;5 reporting the failure
to timely file a Form&nbsp;4 to report the acquisition, as of June&nbsp;21,
2005, of shares of common stock in our rights offering:</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">32</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Code of Ethics</font></b></h3>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has adopted a Code of Ethics
applicable to its Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Controller
and other employees performing similar functions.&#160; In addition, the Company has adopted a Code
of Business Conduct and Ethics applicable to all directors, officers and
employees.&#160; Both Codes are available on
the Company&#146;s website at http://www.cruzaninc.com.&#160; The Company also intends to post any
amendments to, or waivers from, either Code on the Company&#146;s website.&#160; In addition, the Company will also provide to
any person without charge, upon request, a copy of either or both Codes.&#160; Such request may be made in writing to Ezra
Shashoua, the Company&#146;s Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer at
222 Lakeview Avenue, Suite&nbsp;1500, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401, or by
phone at (561) 655-5677.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h2 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Item 11.&#160; Executive Compensation</font></b></h2>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Summary
Compensation Table</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table sets forth information
concerning the annual and long-term compensation for services in all capacities
to the Company for the fiscal years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, 2004 and
2003, of the Chief Executive Officer and&nbsp;the other four most highly
compensated executive officers of the Company serving as of September&nbsp;30,
2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="95%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:95.02%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="34%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:34.36%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.92%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="44%" colspan="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:44.86%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Annual Compensation</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.06%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.16%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.64%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="34%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:34.36%;">

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.98%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">38,115</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.06%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="14%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:14.16%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.64%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

</font></div>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amounts
awarded under the Company&#146;s discretionary bonus arrangement.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes,
in all cases other than to Mr. Shashoua in 2003, amounts awarded under the
Company&#146;s defined contribution pension plan.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-indent:-.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Represents
consulting fees paid by the Company to Mr. Shashoua for consulting services
provided prior to his joining the Company on June 6, 2003.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">33</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='33',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-03.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:14 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Supplemental
Executive Retirement Program</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During Fiscal 2004, the Company implemented a
defined benefit supplemental executive retirement plan (&#147;SERP&#148;) for certain
executive officers, including the five current executive officers named in the
Summary Compensation Table.&#160; The SERP is
a nonqualified deferred compensation plan providing life insurance protection
during employment and subsequent retirement benefits.&#160; The SERP replaces the Company&#146;s Executive
Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Program, which was cancelled during Fiscal
2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For the fiscal year ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, the Company expensed $331,514 with regard to the SERP for the benefit of the
participants.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The formula for determining the monthly
retirement benefit for each executive was derived by making an estimate of the
dollar amount which would equal 30-40% of the executives&#146; anticipated cash
compensation at retirement, and subtracting from this amount estimated benefits
from social security and the Company&#146;s defined contribution pension plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">For all of the named executive officers, upon
the termination of the executive&#146;s employment after attainment of age 65, the
Company will pay the executive a monthly retirement benefit over a period of 15
years, as set forth below.&#160; Retirement
prior to age 65 with consent of the Company shall result in a reduced
retirement benefit based on years of service.&#160;
In the event the executive becomes permanently and totally disabled
while in the employ of the Company, the Company will pay the executive a
monthly disability benefit over a period of five years in an amount equal to
the monthly retirement benefit pro rated over a five-year vesting period, with
full vesting on February&nbsp;20, 2009.&#160;
In the event of the death of the executive prior to retirement, the
executive&#146;s beneficiary shall receive a death benefit as set forth below.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the event of cessation of employment with
the Company for any reason other than death, disability or retirement, the
executive will not be entitled to benefits under the SERP.&#160; In addition, the executive will forfeit all
rights to benefits under the SERP if the executive engages in competition with
the Company during the 2 years following cessation of employment with the
Company.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Under the terms of the SERP, unless the
executive is terminated for cause, the Company may not terminate the SERP
without the executive&#146;s consent beginning nine months before a &#147;Change of
Control.&#148;&#160; Under the SERP, a &#147;Change of
Control&#148; took place on September&nbsp;26, 2005, when ASCI completed the
purchase of its controlling equity stake in the Company from Angostura.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table sets forth the expected
benefits under the SERP for each of the named executive officers at September&nbsp;30,
2005:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Employment
Agreements</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has employment agreements with
each of Messrs.&nbsp;Maltby, Valdes, Shashoua, Mitchell and Yu.&#160; The agreements expire at various dates
through June&nbsp;2009 and are subject to automatic renewal for a one-year
period unless prior notice is given.&#160;
Under these agreements, these executives receive the following minimum
combined base salary and bonus per year, as may be adjusted from time to time:&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Maltby, $717,479; Mr.&nbsp;Valdes,
$455,789; Mr.&nbsp;Shashoua, $417,221; Mr.&nbsp;Mitchell, $320,552; and Mr.&nbsp;Yu,
$298,940.&#160; These agreements also provide
that the executives are entitled to participate in all Company compensation
arrangements or plans, including the</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">34</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-03.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:14 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Company&#146;s discretionary bonus
arrangement, the SERP, the employee stock option plan and pension plan.&#160; The foregoing is a summary of the material
terms of these employment agreements and is qualified by reference to the text
of the agreements, which have been filed as exhibits to the Company&#146;s filings
with the Commission.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Payments to Our Executive Officers from
Angostura</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to a letter agreement entered into
between Angostura, Jay S. Maltby, Thomas A. Valdes and Ezra Shashoua, on June&nbsp;2,
2005, Angostura agreed to pay to certain of the Company&#146;s Management, including
these three executive officers, an aggregate amount of $9 million if the sale
of Angostura&#146;s controlling interest in the Company to ASCI were completed.&#160; Although this sale was completed on September&nbsp;26,
2005, to the Company&#146;s knowledge this payment has not yet been made.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h3 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock Options</font></b></h3>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h5 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:normal;">Option
Grants In Last Fiscal Year</font></i></b></h5>

<h5 style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></i></b></h5>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table provides information
regarding stock options granted to the five named executive officers during
Fiscal 2005.&#160; In addition, the table
shows the hypothetical gains of &#147;option spreads&#148; that would exist for the
respective options.&#160; These gains are
based on assumed rates of annual compound stock price appreciation of 5% and
10% from the date the options were granted over the full option term.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>These
options were granted on February&nbsp;24, 2005, and become exercisable as to
6.25% of such options per quarter commencing March&nbsp;31, 2005.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .3in;text-indent:-.3in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>These
amounts represent assumed rates of appreciation only.&#160; Actual gains, if any, on stock option
exercises will depend on the actual stock price on the date of exercise.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<h5 align="center" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:auto;punctuation-wrap:simple;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;text-indent:.5in;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">Aggregate Option Exercises In Last Fiscal Year And Fiscal Year-End
Option Values</font></i></b></h5>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-indent:.5in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table sets forth information
concerning the unexercised options held by the named executive officers at September&nbsp;30,
2005.&#160; There were no options exercised by
the named executive officers during Fiscal 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.76%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28,126</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:16.76%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,039,747</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="24%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:24.36%;">

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.74%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.35in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>These
options have per share exercise prices of $8.13 to $12.55, and expire from February&nbsp;2006
through February&nbsp;2015.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .6in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .7in;text-indent:-.35in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amounts
reflect pre-tax gains on outstanding options based on the September&nbsp;30,
2005 stock price less the exercise price of the options.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">35</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>
