<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='52',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-05.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:13 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Cruzan International, Inc. and Subsidiaries</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><a name="NotesToConsolidatedFinancialState_191940"></a><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Notes to Consolidated Financial
Statements</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 1.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nature
of Business and Significant Accounting Policies</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Nature of business</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cruzan
International,&nbsp;Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;), is a leading producer and supplier of
rum, brandy, wine and spirits to other beverage alcohol manufacturers;
produces, imports and markets premium branded spirits; bottles beverage alcohol
and other beverages on a contract basis and under private labels; and produces
vinegar and cooking wine.&#160; The Company
operates four production facilities in the United States and one in St. Croix,
United States Virgin Islands and purchases certain products for resale.&#160; In May&nbsp;2005, the Company changed its
name from Todhunter International,&nbsp;Inc. to Cruzan International,&nbsp;Inc.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Ownership</font></u>:&#160; On
June&nbsp;3, 2005, the Company announced that Angostura, Ltd. (&#147;Angostura&#148;),
the Company&#146;s then controlling stockholder, had entered into a Stock Purchase
Agreement with&#160; V&amp;S Vin&nbsp;&amp;
Sprit AB, a Swedish-based international wine and spirits company (&#147;V&amp;S&#148;),
pursuant to which V&amp;S agreed to purchase Angostura&#146;s controlling interest
in the Company.&#160; Upon the terms and
subject to the conditions set forth in the Stock Purchase Agreement, V&amp;S
agreed to purchase all 4,294,583 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock
beneficially owned by Angostura, representing approximately 63.6% of the
Company&#146;s outstanding common stock, for an aggregate consideration of
$121,837,320, or $28.37 per share.&#160;
V&amp;S subsequently assigned its rights in the Stock Purchase Agreement
to The Absolut Spirits Company,&nbsp;Inc., a Delaware corporation (&#147;ASCI&#148;), its
wholly-owned subsidiary.&#160; The purchase
and sale closed on September&nbsp;26, 2005.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On July&nbsp;8, 2005, the Company announced that ASCI had submitted a
proposed Agreement and Plan of Merger pursuant to which a wholly-owned
subsidiary of ASCI would merge with and into the Company, and each issued share
of Company common stock not owned by Angostura would be converted into the
right to receive $28.37 in cash (the &#147;ASCI Proposal&#148;).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On September&nbsp;30, 2005, the Company, ASCI, and Cruzan Acquisition,&nbsp;Inc.,
a Delaware corporation and a direct, wholly-owned subsidiary of ASCI (&#147;Sub&#148;),
entered into an Agreement and Plan of Merger (the &#147;Merger Agreement&#148;).&#160; The Merger Agreement provides that, upon the
terms and subject to the conditions set forth in the Merger Agreement, Sub will
merge with and into the Company (the &#147;Merger&#148;), with the Company continuing as
the surviving corporation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Subsequent to September&nbsp;30, 2005, the Company filed a preliminary
proxy statement and other relevant documents concerning the ASCI Proposal with
the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;) and intends to
call a Special Meeting of its stockholders to vote on the Merger.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to the Merger Agreement, all fees and expenses incurred in
connection with the Merger will be paid by the party incurring those expenses,
whether or not the Merger is completed. &#160;The Merger Agreement also provides that upon a
termination in specified circumstances, the Company must pay a termination fee
of $3,000,000 to ASCI. &#160;In addition, if
ASCI terminates the Merger Agreement in specified circumstances, the Company
would be obligated to reimburse ASCI for all of its documented out-of-pocket
expenses actually incurred up to a maximum of $1,500,000 in connection with the
Merger Agreement or the Merger. &#160;The
termination fee is subject to a credit for any expense reimbursement paid and
no expense reimbursement shall be due if the Company has previously paid the
termination fee.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">53</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='53',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-05.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:13 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pursuant to a letter agreement entered into
between Angostura and certain of the Company&#146;s management, on June&nbsp;2,
2005, Angostura agreed to pay to certain of the Company&#146;s management, an
aggregate amount of $9&nbsp;million if the sale of Angostura&#146;s controlling
interest in the Company to ASCI were completed.&#160;
Although this sale was completed on September&nbsp;26, 2005, as of December&nbsp;16,
2005, this payment has not been made.&#160;
This payment is not the obligation of the Company and was negotiated
between certain members of management and the former majority owner without the
participation of ratification by the Company&#146;s board of directors or any
committee thereof and does not affect the Company&#146;s balance sheet or cash flow
statement.&#160; However, under Staff
Accounting Bulletin 107 issued by the Securities and Exchange commission
relating to accounting for expenses or liabilities paid by principal
stockholder(s), this expected payment by Angostura was treated as an expense of
the Company in the statement of operations, and as a contribution to additional
paid-in capital on the balance sheet.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
summary of the Company&#146;s significant accounting policies follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Principles
of consolidation</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The consolidated financial statements include
the accounts of Cruzan International,&nbsp;Inc. and all of its majority-owned
subsidiaries.&#160; All significant
intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated in consolidation.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Accounting
estimates</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The preparation of financial statements in
accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States, requires
management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts
of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities
at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues
and expenses during the reporting period.&#160;
Actual results could differ from those estimates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revenue
recognition</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company recognizes revenue when its
product is shipped, at which time title passes to the customer.&#160; Revenues from contract bottling services are
recognized at the time the bottling process is completed.&#160; Excise taxes on products sold are billed
directly to customers and are included in sales at the same time the product
sold is recognized as revenue.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Cash
equivalents</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company considers certificates of deposit
and other short-term investments with an original maturity of three months or
less to be cash equivalents.&#160; The Company
maintains depository accounts in excess of FDIC insured limits.&#160; The Company has not experienced any credit
losses in such accounts and does not anticipate any losses.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Functional
currency</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The functional currency for all foreign
subsidiaries is the U.S dollar.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Short-term
investments</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company has investments in certificates
of deposit and commercial paper, which mature within one year of purchase.&#160; All of the Company&#146;s short-term investments
are classified as held-to-maturity and are carried at amortized cost.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trade
receivables</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company records trade receivables at cost,
which approximates fair value at the respective balance sheet dates.&#160; The Company estimates its allowance for
doubtful accounts based on a combination of historical and current information
regarding the balance of trade receivables, as well as the current composition
of the pool of trade receivables.&#160; The
Company determines status on trade receivables based on the contractual terms
of the original sale.&#160; Trade receivables
that management believes to be uncollectible are written off upon such
determination.&#160; Recoveries of accounts
receivable previously written off are recorded when received.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">54</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='54',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-05.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:13 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Inventories</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Inventories are stated at the lower of cost
or market.&#160; Cost is determined using the
first-in, first-out method.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Investment
in Equity Investees</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Investments in business entities in which the
Company does not have control, but has the ability to exercise significant
influence over operating and financial policies (generally 20-50% ownership),
are accounted for by the equity method.&#160;
Under the equity method of accounting, the Company&#146;s share of the net
income or (loss) of the investee is recognized as income or (loss) in the
Company&#146;s statement of operations and added to or deducted from the investment
account, and dividends received from the investee are treated as a reduction of
the investment account.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Property
and equipment</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Property and equipment is stated at
cost.&#160; Depreciation is calculated on the
straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of the various classes of
depreciable assets.&#160; Estimated lives are
as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="89%" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:.15in;width:89.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="85%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:85.14%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-align:center;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.76%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Years</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="85%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:85.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Land improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.76%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 &#150; 20</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="85%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:85.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Buildings and improvements</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.76%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 &#150; 40</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="85%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:85.14%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Machinery and equipment</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.36%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.76%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3 &#150; 20</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trademarks</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Amortization of trademarks held are computed
on the straight-line basis over the estimated lives of the trademarks.&#160; Estimated lives are three to forty years (see
Note 7).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred
loan costs</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Deferred loan costs included in interest
expense are computed using the effective interest method over the term of the
loan (see Note 7).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Impairment
of long-lived assets</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; As of October&nbsp;1, 2001, the Company
adopted Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;144, (&#147;SFAS 144&#148;),
<i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for the Impairment or Disposal of
Long-Lived Assets</font></i>.&#160; Long-lived
assets held for use are subject to an impairment assessment if the carrying
value is no longer recoverable based upon the undiscounted future cash flows of
the asset or fair value less costs to sell.&#160;
The amount of impairment is the difference between the carrying amount
and the fair value of the related asset.&#160;
The Company&#146;s estimate of undiscounted cash flows or fair value less
costs to sell indicated that such carrying amounts were expected to be
recovered.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Income
taxes</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Deferred income tax assets and liabilities
are computed for differences between the financial statement and tax bases of
assets and liabilities that will result in taxable or deductible amounts in the
future based on enacted tax laws and rates applicable to the periods in which
the differences are expected to affect taxable income.&#160; Valuation allowances are established when
necessary to reduce deferred tax assets to the amount expected to be realized.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Preferred
stock</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company has authorized 2,500,000 shares
of $.01 par value preferred stock.&#160; No
terms are stated as to dividend, liquidation or other rights applicable to
these shares.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">55</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='55',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-05.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:13 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock
options</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company applies Accounting Principles
Board Opinion Number 25, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for
Stock Issued to Employees</font></i> (&#147;APB 25&#148;) and related interpretations in
accounting for options granted, which requires compensation expense for the
Company&#146;s options to be recognized only if the market price of the underlying
stock exceeds the exercise price on the date of grant.&#160; Accordingly, the Company has not recognized
compensation expense for its options granted after 1994.&#160; SFAS 123, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting
for Stock-Based Compensation</font></i>, issued in October&nbsp;1995, requires
pro forma disclosures for option grants made after December&nbsp;31, 1994, when
accounting for stock-based compensation plans in accordance with APB 25.&#160; As of January&nbsp;1, 2003, the Company
adopted SFAS 148, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Stock-Based
Compensation-Transition and Disclosure</font></i>, an amendment of SFAS 123.
The standard amends SFAS 123 to provide alternative methods of transition for
voluntary changes to the fair value based method of accounting for stock-based
employee compensation. &#160;Additionally,
SFAS 148 amends the disclosure requirements of SFAS 123 to require pro-forma
disclosures when the intrinsic value method continues to be used.&#160; The Company has elected to continue
accounting for stock-based compensation using the intrinsic method in
accordance with APB 25, and has adopted the new disclosure requirements
specified under SFAS 148.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">If
the Company had elected to recognize compensation cost based on the fair value
of the options granted at grant date as prescribed by SFAS No.&nbsp;123, net
income (loss) and earnings (loss) per common share would have been reduced to
the pro forma amounts shown below:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.16</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.76%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.46%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:13.34%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.61</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.76%;">

  </td>
 </tr>

  <td width="44%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:44.56%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.76%;">

</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
pro forma effects are determined as if compensation costs were recognized using
the fair value based accounting method.&#160; The
fair value of each grant is estimated at the grant date using the Black-Scholes
option-pricing model with the following weighted-average assumptions for grants
in 1998, 1999, and 2005, respectively: expected price volatility of 29 percent,
30 percent and 25 percent, risk-free interest rates of 4.50 percent, 4.50&nbsp;percent
and 4.27 percent; and a 0 percent dividend yield.&#160; The weighted-average fair value of options
granted during 2005 was $5.74.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">56</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='56',FILE='C:\JMS\jbritto\05-18427-1\task744209\18427-1-ba-05.htm',USER='jbritto',CD='Jan 12 03:13 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;text-indent:.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2004, the
FASB issued Statement No.&nbsp;123R, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Share-Based Payment</font></i>
(SFAS 123R).&#160; On April&nbsp;15, 2005, the
SEC amended its rule&nbsp;regarding the effective date of SFAS 123R, thereby
delaying the effective date for the Company to its fiscal year beginning October&nbsp;1,
2005.&#160; SFAS 123R requires all share-based
payments to employees to be expensed over the requisite service period based on
the grant-date fair value of the awards and requires that the unvested portion
of all outstanding awards upon adoption be recognized using the same fair value
and attribution methodologies previously determined under Statement No.&nbsp;123,
<i><font style="font-style:italic;">Accounting for Stock-Based Compensation</font></i>.&#160; As a result, pro forma compensation expense,
as reflected above, may not be indicative of future expense to be recognized
under SFAS 123R.&#160; The effect of adoption
of SFAS 123R on the Company&#146;s financial position or results of operations has
not yet been determined.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;text-indent:.2pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Intangible
assets</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; As of October&nbsp;1, 2001, the Company
adopted SFAS 142, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Goodwill and Other
Intangible Assets</font></i>.&#160; SFAS 142
supersedes APB Opinion No.&nbsp;17, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Intangible
Assets</font></i>, and requires goodwill and other intangible assets that have
an indefinite useful life to no longer be amortized; however, these assets must
be reviewed at least annually for impairment.&#160;
As required by SFAS 142, the Company has completed the goodwill
impairment test and has concluded that there was no impairment to goodwill as
of and for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Advertising
costs</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Advertising costs are charged to expense as
incurred.&#160; Advertising costs were
$3,833,168, $2,841,768 and $589,648 for the years ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, 2004, and 2003, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Reclassifications</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; Certain amounts in the 2004 and 2003
consolidated financial statements have been reclassified to conform with the
2005 presentation with no effect on net income (loss) or stockholders&#146; equity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 2.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Inventories</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
major components of inventories as of September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004 are:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="70%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.04%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2005</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.46%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2004</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.7%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="70%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Finished goods</font></p>
  </td>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 4.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notes
Receivable From Affiliates</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

receivable from affiliates consist of the following as of September&nbsp;30,
2005 and 2004:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 5.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trade
Credits</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company entered into
an agreement with a corporate trading company to receive trade credits upon
installment deliveries of ready-to-drink beverages (&#147;products&#148;) from buyers
obtained by the corporate trading company.&#160;
The Company has $500,000 as of September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004,
included in other current assets on the accompanying consolidated balance
sheets.&#160; Additionally, the Company has
$1,163,269 and $1,176,809 as of September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, respectively,
included in other assets, on the accompanying consolidated balance sheets.&#160; Earned trade credits must be utilized by June&nbsp;30,
2008 and are subject to terms as more specifically defined in the agreement. </font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">58</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

and Equipment</b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 7.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trademarks
and Deferred Loan Costs</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Trademarks
and deferred loan costs consist of the following as of September&nbsp;30, 2005
and 2004:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Amortization
charged to trademarks were $87,845 for 2005 and $40,200 for 2004 and 2003.&#160; Amounts charged to interest expense for
deferred loan costs were $588,809, $308,904 and $299,004, for the fiscal years
ended 2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

aggregate amortization of deferred loan costs and trademarks for each of the
next five years is as follows:</font></p>

<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 9.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financing
Arrangements</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Long-term
debt consists of the following as of September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr>
  <td width="70%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.04%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2005</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.46%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;font-weight:bold;">2004</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="1" style="height:1.0pt;">
  <td width="70%" height="1" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;height:1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Term loans under a credit agreement (i)&nbsp;and
  (ii), interest payable monthly based on either the Eurodollar or prime rate
  at the Company&#146;s option, plus an applicable margin as defined in the agreement.&nbsp; The interest rate as of September&nbsp;30,
  2005 was 6.92%.&nbsp; Future minimum
  quarterly principal installments of $1,000,000 through January&nbsp;31, 2006
  with any remaining balance due on January&nbsp;31, 2006</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" height="1" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;height:1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" height="1" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;border:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;height:1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.74%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">24,000,000</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" height="1" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;height:1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28,000,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" height="1" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;height:1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr height="1" style="height:1.0pt;">
  <td width="70%" height="1" valign="top" style="height:1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Revolving loans under a credit agreement (i)&nbsp;and
  (ii), interest payable quarterly based on either the Eurodollar or prime rate
  at the Company&#146;s option, plus an applicable margin as defined in the
  agreement. The blended interest rate as of September&nbsp;30, 2005 was 6.91%.
  The revolving lines of credit terminate in January&nbsp;2006</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" height="1" valign="bottom" style="height:1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12%" colspan="2" height="1" valign="bottom" style="height:1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:12.04%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">4,600,000</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" height="1" valign="bottom" style="height:1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11%" colspan="2" height="1" valign="bottom" style="height:1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:11.46%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>In October&nbsp;2001,
the Company entered into a $70 million credit agreement, consisting of a $40
million term loan and a $30 million revolving loan facility.&#160; During March&nbsp;2004, the credit agreement
was amended to reduce the revolving loan facility to $15 million.&#160; In December&nbsp;2004, the maturity date of
the credit agreement was modified to January&nbsp;31, 2006.&#160; The credit agreement is collateralized
principally by all assets located in the United States of America.&#160; Under this credit agreement, the Company has
certain limitations in its ability to pay dividends to stockholders.&#160; Also, the Company is required to maintain
certain financial covenants under the credit agreement.</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .5in;text-indent:-.25in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ii)</font><font size="1" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
credit agreement was due to expire in January&nbsp;2006.&#160; In December&nbsp;2005, the Company entered
into a loan arrangement with V&amp;S to refinance the credit agreement with a
$30 million term promissory note and a $10 million revolving promissory note,
both of which are unsecured, bear interest at the applicable LIBOR rate plus 90
basis points and mature on December&nbsp;15, 2006.&#160; The notes are nonamortizing and have no
financial covenant requirements.&#160; Since
the proceeds of the notes were used to repay the loans under the credit
agreement, the amounts outstanding as of September&nbsp;30, 2005 have been
classified as long-term debt.</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">61</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

<div>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
deferred tax amounts mentioned above have been classified on the accompanying
consolidated balance sheets as of September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004 as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

 <tr>
  <td width="70%" valign="top" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">

  <td width="70%" valign="top" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:70.0%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Noncurrent
  assets (liabilities)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">No
valuation allowance has been recorded as of September&nbsp;30, 2005 or 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

tax expense (benefits) differed from the amounts computed by applying the
statutory federal income tax rate to income before income taxes as a result of
the following for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, 2004 and 2003:</font></p>

  benefits</font></p>

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">$</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.72%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">(3,887,748</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 1.5pt 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">)</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.72%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3,692,087</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 1.5pt 0in;width:2.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.3%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="10%" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:double windowtext 1.5pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:10.0%;">
  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(956,202</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 1.5pt 0in;width:1.66%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Generally,
the income of the Company&#146;s Bahamian subsidiary is not subject to United States
income taxes and there are no income taxes in the Commonwealth of the Bahamas.&#160; Certain passive income of the Company&#146;s Bahamian
subsidiary is subject to United States income taxes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Virgin Islands subsidiary, through the Industrial Development Commission of the
Government of the Virgin Islands of the United States, has received a 90%
exemption from income taxes on operating income.&#160; This exemption is effective through September&nbsp;2020.&#160; The per share effect of this exemption on
earnings on a basic and diluted basis for the years ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively, is as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">With
respect to the Company&#146;s foreign subsidiaries, no provision has been made for
taxes, which would result from the remittance of such undistributed earnings as
the Company intends to reinvest these earnings indefinitely.&#160; The Company&#146;s aggregate share of
undistributed earnings of its foreign subsidiaries was approximately $47.5 million
and $43.7 million as of September&nbsp;30, 2005 and 2004, respectively.&#160; The undistributed earnings of the Company&#146;s
foreign subsidiaries have been reduced by any previously taxed income.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 11.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Commitments</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Leases</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; The Company occupies office space under
noncancelable operating leases, which expire through December&nbsp;2006.&#160; One of the leases contains two renewal
options of five years each.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Future
minimum lease payments under these noncancelable operating leases, as of September&nbsp;30,
2005 are as follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">495,540</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="1%" valign="bottom" bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="background:#CCEEFF;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:1.5%;">
  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>

</table>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Rent
expense for office space (including the Company&#146;s share of common area
expenses, real estate and sales taxes) amounted to $520,778, $503,519 and
$484,782 for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, 2004 and 2003,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Event
sponsorship</font></u><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">:&#160; In 2004, the Company entered into a
noncancelable agreement with an entertainer to promote one of the Company&#146;s
trademarked products.&#160; The agreement
covers the calendar years 2005 through 2007 with total fees amounting to
$4,271,745, of which $1,058,500 has been paid as of September&nbsp;30, 2005.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 12.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock
Options</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At September&nbsp;30,
2005, the Company has two stock option plans for the grant of options to key
employees.&#160; As permitted under accounting
principles generally accepted in the United States, the Company accounts for
these plans under the recognition and measurement principles of APB Opinion 25<i><font style="font-style:italic;">, Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees</font></i>, and related
interpretations.&#160; Accordingly, no stock-based
employee compensation cost has been recognized, as all options granted under
these plans had an exercise price equal to the fair value of the underlying
common stock on the date of the grant.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">64</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='64',FILE='C:\JMS\svasudea\05-18427-1\task743861\18427-1-ba-07.htm',USER='avchinnasamy',CD='Jan 11 23:16 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On
February&nbsp;24, 2005, the Company granted 549,000 options (which leaves
304,000 options available for future issuance) at an exercise price of $12.55
per share which was the fair value at that date, and these options had an
expiration date occurring in ten years.&#160;
Options granted vest quarterly over four years.&#160; The Company has received a total of $9,413,
$300,625 and $139,125 upon the exercise of stock options for 750, 37,000 and
17,000 shares for the years ended September&nbsp;2005, 2004 and 2003,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
reconciliation of the Company&#146;s stock option activity, and related information,
for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, 2004 and 2003 follows:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">February&nbsp;2015</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">65</font></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='65',FILE='C:\JMS\svasudea\05-18427-1\task743861\18427-1-ba-07.htm',USER='avchinnasamy',CD='Jan 11 23:16 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 13.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Segment
and Geographic Information</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company operates primarily in the beverage alcohol industry in the United
States.&#160; The Company reports its
operating results in four operating segments:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Bulk
Alcohol Products (rum, citrus brandy, citrus spirits, cane spirits, fortified
citrus wine, purchased distilled products and byproducts)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Premium
Branded Spirits (primarily Cruzan Estate Rums and Cruzan Flavored Rums)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Bottling
Operations (contract bottling services and private label products)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Vinegar
and Cooking Wine (bulk vinegar, bulk cooking wine, vinegar stock and
proprietary and private label case goods)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Corporate
Operations (includes certain expenses of the Company&#146;s executive offices that
are not allocated to the operating segments described above)</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt .15in;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">The accounting policies of
the reportable segments are the same as those described in Note 1 to the
Consolidated Financial Statements.&#160; The
Company evaluates the performance of its operating segments based on income
before income taxes, equity in income of equity investees, interest income and
expense.&#160; Material intersegment sales and
transfers have been eliminated.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">66</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>

  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;width:.9%;">

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included
in net sales for the United States are export sales, primarily to Eastern
Europe, Canada and the Caribbean, totaling approximately $5,460,000, $8,000,000
and $6,300,000 for the years ended September&nbsp;30, 2005, 2004 and 2003,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 14.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Defined
Contribution Retirement Plan</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company has a defined contribution retirement plan which covers substantially
all employees.&#160; Generally, employer contributions
to the plan begin to vest to the benefit of the participant after three years
of service.&#160; Participants are immediately
vested in any elective contributions and related earnings, if any.&#160; Participants are entitled, upon retirement,
to their vested portion of the retirement fund assets.&#160; The Company contributed $1,228,385,
$1,206,986 and $967,962 to the plan for the years ended September&nbsp;30,
2005, 2004 and 2003, respectively.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">68</font></p>

<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='68',FILE='C:\JMS\svasudea\05-18427-1\task743861\18427-1-ba-07.htm',USER='avchinnasamy',CD='Jan 11 23:16 2006' -->


<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note 15.</font></b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Supplemental
Executive Retirement Plan</font></p>

<p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;margin:0in 0in .0001pt .75in;text-align:left;text-indent:-.75in;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During
2004, the Company&#146;s Compensation and Stock Option Committee approved a
supplemental executive retirement plan for certain key executives of the
Company.&#160; The Company has entered into
life insurance contracts to provide future cash proceeds in connection with
these liabilities.&#160; The plan is an
unfunded plan within the meaning of Statement of Financial Accounting Standard No.&nbsp;132.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

discount rate used to determine benefit obligations and net periodic benefit
costs was 6%.</font></p>

  <p align="right" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">76,517</font></p>
